All the archives and extensions will soon go down. Read why here: http://chan-dev-alliance.us/ and vote to give us a chance to keep existing.

Make sure to save the threads you care about before we are gone!

Super Robot Wars GC Translation Thread #13: Riding Sayla Edition
Bring Stabity Mon Mar 31 2014 01:53:55 No.10595246 ViewReport	
Previous thread is at:
>>10261952
All you need to know (links, installing, troubleshooting, etc):
http://pastebin.com/CYDquvFD

IMPORTANT: This now works on Dolphin 4.0.

Folder containing the stuff we've done:
mediafire.com/srwgc

PDF explaining how this works and how to use the tools for translating: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rzlnrnogfzw7kk6/SRW%20GC%20Translation%20Toolkit%20Tutorial.zip

Demo Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=93IHK2DraFE

Progress so far: Roughly 31%.

Menus translated up to mission 30.
Stages translated up to mission 19.
QC up to mission 12.
Battle lines translated up to mission 19ish.

Next thing to look forward to:
Stage 20 translation

After that:
Second Mega batch containing edited event and dialogue dialogue up to mission 20, which will mark 33% completion (of the first route).

As I was editing the script for stage 12, I realized that I needed to make pic related.

>When will we finish?
SOON!

Gunpla/Plamo General
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Sun Mar 30 2014 07:01:05 No.10590742 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

Old Thread >>10575903 (You/OP)

Gunpla/Plamo General
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Thu Mar 27 2014 04:00:04 No.10575903 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

All the archives and extensions will soon go down. Read why here: http://chan-dev-alliance.us/ and vote to give us a chance to keep existing.
If you are an extension developer, make sure to contact us as soon as possible.
Make sure to save the threads you care about before we are gone!

Mazinger Otome Taisen
Oppai-Missile Tue Mar 25 2014 02:26:17 No.10565037 ViewReport	
Download: mediafire.com/download/q636h555svnwng8/Mazinger_Otome_Taisen_[oppai-missile].zip

Well, this was pretty fast even for me. This series is just so much fun that I couldn't stop working on it. I ended up translating most of it over the weekend and managed to finish it just now.
This volume is really awesome by the way, it's pretty much all fighting and there's a bunch of original Mazinger designs and upgrades for everyone and boobies. Enjoy.

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO GunplaGeneral.jpg, 706 kB, 1600x1200
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Mon Mar 24 2014 02:59:33 No.10559016 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

Old Thread >>10549003

All the archives and extensions will soon go down. Read why here: http://chan-dev-alliance.us/ and vote to give us a chance to keep existing.

Anonymous Sun Mar 23 2014 00:41:13 No.10553337 ViewReport	
>>10552936
>the paint runs off the parts so don't use it.
That's because you need to do two things beforehand:
1. You need to primer the model beforehand.
2. Nail polish can be used on plastic models, but only with an airbrush and your paint is properly thinned. Nail polish (a type of hot lacquer), when brushed straight from the bottle, will come off easily. Or, worse, eat up the plastic.

A couple of video tutorials:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=msJH6vrpwNA
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DS33baMfusA

And a PDF guide:
https://www.mediafire.com/folder/mlguhzyb0c987/

Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Sat Mar 22 2014 05:14:15 No.10549003 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

[Notice shared with all archives]
All the archives and extensions will soon go down. Read why here: http://chan-dev-alliance.us/ and vote to give us a chance to keep existing.

Gunpla/Plamo General
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Wed Mar 19 2014 20:54:12 No.10534788 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

dorkly chair of the institute for space politics Wed Mar 19 2014 16:52:30 No.10533440 ViewReport	
>>10533303
The book is MS Era
I know of three editions.
MS Era. The first version. Published in slightly mangled English.
MS Era 0099. Revised edition with better English and a tweak here and there in the pics
MS Era Popular Edition. Translated into Japanese with a page dropped for some reason.

http://www.mediafire.com/view/7o009d34qggwl2q/incomplete_msera_transcript.txt I transcribed this from my copy of MS Era 0099. There's an Italian gundam image site that linking to pops an instaban that has low res scans of the first version. Popular should be in /rs/ or foolz.

Gunpla / Plamo General
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Mon Mar 17 2014 02:56:48 No.10517645 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

Anonymous Sat Mar 15 2014 19:20:43 No.10509026 ViewReport	
>>10508787

The Iwamoto Rockman X manga is also really great. It's a shame there are only fantranslations available of it, but they do the job. The X1 manga is easy to find on Dr. Neko's site (just google scanlation Rockman X or something).

The Rockman X2 manga was also translated, but due to faggots no one has it saved a proper DL link for it at this moment. I just have the final chapter of the fantranslated Rockman X2 manga saved.

X3 isn't hosted on the net as far I know, but you can download it from here.

http://www.mediafire.com/download/izq53cce369o83f/RMX3_manga_part1.rar
http://www.mediafire.com/download/7zy077auo502lec/RMX3_manga_part2.rar
Does not include bonus chapters as they haven't been translated yet.

Just be warned though, these are quite a little bit longer than your average mangas (around 700 pages for the Rockman X3 manga).

Stay the fuck away from the Rockman Zero manga though, don't even think of touching it.

All the archives and extensions will soon go down. Read why here: http://chan-dev-alliance.us/ and vote to give us a chance to keep existing.

Anonymous Sat Mar 15 2014 14:27:03 No.10507852 ViewReport	
>>10507845
here it is again anyways along with the guide

http://www.mediafire.com/download/v5e77q7ywaj2iw8/Digimon+Unlimited_1.56.apk

? Evolution Success Rate and Requirement
** Fresh (baby 1) -> In-Training (baby 2)
- Baby 2A: 5 or more Training
- Baby 2B: 4 or less Training

** In-Training (baby 2) -> Rookie
- Rookie A: 2 or less Penalty
- Rookie B: 3~5 Penalty


- Rookie C: 6 or more Penalty

** Rookie -> Champion
- Champion A: 25 or more Training, 3 or less Penalty
- Champion B: 25 or more Training, 4 or more Penalty
- Champion C: 24 or less Training, 3 or less Penalty
- Champion D: 24 or less Training, 4 or more Penalty

** Champion -> Ultimate
- At least 30 time Battle(s)
- At most 3 Penalty(s)
- Battle Win Rate of 100%: 60% success rate to evolve
Battle Win Rate of 80%: 50% success rate to evolve
Battle Win Rate of 70%: 40% success rate to evolve
Battle Win Rate of 40%: 20% success rate to evolve
(Notice 40% mean 69% to 40%)
* When DigiEgg is moving before it hatches, 100 or more shake would increase the evolution rate by 10%
* The amount of time a Digimon died and became DigiEgg
- 10 or more: 30% increase on evolution rate
- 5 or more: 20% increase on the evolution rate
- 1 or more: 10% increase on the evolution rate
* If an official “Androgochi” application is installed: 10% increase on the evolution rate

** Ultimate -> Mega
- At most 2 Penalty(s)
- Other Requirements are same of Champion -> Ultimate

** Mega -> Super Ultimate
- At most 1 Penalty
- At least 100 or more Battle(s)
- 100% evolution rate upon reaching these two requirements

***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

Paul 'OtaKing' Johnson !!UtFBAkwWhRI Tue Mar 11 2014 05:47:01 No.10487357 ViewReport	
I didn't have long to do this, but take a look if you're bored, and critique away!

http://www.mediafire.com/download/xrrddgmigso2dol/Coffin.ipad.mp4

It's /m/ because space stations and droids and shit.
Basically, back in our college days, me and two other guys made this horror game, which is looking old and embarassing now. So we're going back, giving it a graphical update, new voice acting etc etc... and this is the new intro sequence I just knocked up.
Compare it to the old 2005 version with my shitty drawings:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zzwIMR2AWSg

Music by Zak Rahman
Programming by Rich Perrin

***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

Raul 'Otter Marquis' Johansen !!UtFBAkwWhRI Tue Feb 25 2014 16:14:49 No.10412996 ViewReport	
I have a gift for you.

If you've never heard any Hummingbird (Yoshiki Fukuyama's real life band until they split up and he joined JAM Project) then prepare to cry tears of happiness and strange melancholy as Basara's voice sings to you about everything from the Galapagos islands, to making a map, to fishing:

http://www.mediafire.com/download/4zmpj5j9h04177u/HummingBird.rar

The discography info:
http://www.fukuyama-yoshiki.net/disco_hummingbird.html

The album "123" is fucking incredible and came out as Mac 7 was airing. It has a lot of Firebomber songs on it but with different lyrics ("Mada ma ni au sa" instead of "Power to the Dream," "Fly Away" instead of "Try Again," etc)

Gunpla General
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Mon Feb 24 2014 15:11:17 No.10405981 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. I've done my best to answer basic and commonly asked questions. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO rx78manga0007.jpg, 899 kB, 1433x2024
Anonymous Mon Feb 24 2014 01:55:55 No.10402169 ViewReport	
I translated this really old, obscure Gundam manga a few years back. Only like two or three people actually downloaded it from my Mediafire account, which has long since been lost. I could upload it again if people are interested at all.

It's just under 30 pages, and is really non-canon even for a manga. It's about Tem Ray using a captured Zeon pilot to test his prototype RX78 (which is goofy looking as fuck, see pic) and befriending him 4 months before the events of the show. It was a pretty fun little read.

If anyone is interested I could re-upload it somewhere tomorrow.

Ep 20 - 'The Invasion Begins With the End of the World'
The fight between Kouta and Takatora in Helheim. In the middle of their fight, they eventually see giant ruins of a city overrun by Helheim's plants. Takatora tells Kouta the truth about all the invess they've been fighting until now "Inves is the animals and humans in this world that ate Helheim's fruits" Kouta was devastated when he heard about this.

Ep 21 - 'Yggdrasil's Secret'
Kouta, who already knew the secret behind helheim forest think that people should be let known about the truth of this matter. But if this fact was known by the people, it will cause a panic over all the people. Micchy said "That's why we are fighting in order to protect humanity" to the confused Kouta.

Ep 20 - 'The Invasion Begins With the End of the World'
The fight between Kouta and Takatora in Helheim. In the middle of their fight, they eventually see giant ruins of a city overrun by Helheim's plants. Takatora tells Kouta the truth about all the invess they've been fighting until now "Inves is the animals and humans in this world that ate Helheim's fruits" Kouta was devastated when he heard about this.

Ep 21 - 'Yggdrasil's Secret'
Kouta, who already knew the secret behind helheim forest think that people should be let known about the truth of this matter. But if this fact was known by the people, it will cause a panic over all the people. Micchy said "That's why we are fighting in order to protect humanity" to the confused Kouta.

Gunpla General Thread
Anonymous Sat Feb 22 2014 02:20:41 No.10390033 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. I've done my best to answer basic and commonly asked questions. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

Anonymous Wed Feb 19 2014 23:25:05 No.10379368 ViewReport

>>10379024
do either of you have sources?

http://www.mediafire.com/view/vo27bq9q4ct27d5/Turn_Types_-_proofread_and_revised.txt

>Its has several different contradicting stories about its origin, and the truth is unknown.
>One explanation says that it was a machine made for interstellar travel by the newtypes that somehow found its way to Earth, and that the Earthnoids, expecting an invasion, then studied it to improve their technology and created the Turn A.
>On the other hand, Ghingnham says that it was created to be the successor to the Turn A, and that it is superior.
>(Note: I've seen stuff on 2ch saying that it was the Turn A that drifted to Earth, and that the Turn X is a copy based on it)
>The only definite fact we know off its past is that it fought the Turn A, lost, and that Earth's civilization was then destroyed by the Turn A.

Gunpla General
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Tue Feb 18 2014 22:39:47 No.10373614 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. I've done my best to answer basic and commonly asked questions. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

Gunpla General
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Sun Feb 16 2014 05:12:10 No.10356300 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>10373614
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. I've done my best to answer basic and commonly asked questions. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

Keroro for /m/

What better way to celebrate my birthday than by helping some people online steal copies of a decade old cartoon about a frog! Clearly these thirty-three years have been well spent.

I'm going to be doing follow-ups that work with the same directories as I find more episodes. I'll also eventually throw in the first PS2 game.

The torrent will probably work. So far I've been able to get these going but that's been due to luck more than knowledge.

Gunpla General
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Tue Feb 18 2014 22:39:47 No.10373614 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. I've done my best to answer basic and commonly asked questions. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

Gunpla General
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Sun Feb 16 2014 05:12:10 No.10356300 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>10373614
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. I've done my best to answer basic and commonly asked questions. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. I've done my best to answer basic and commonly asked questions. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

Rizon

Upcoming episodes

Episode 18: Blood Hound
Meijin Kawaguchi is about to play against the Renato brothers for next round. Kawaguchi is performing a successful fight, but is troubled by the tactics of the clever brother of Renatos.

Episode 19: Blade of Astray
On the battle eve of Nils Nielsen, Nils calls Sei and Reiji. "I have something I need to ask from you two. It's alright to forfeit the battle if you tell me." What are his motives?

Episode 20: Aila the Betrayer
The best 8 are advancing, and Fellini is taking the field. His opponent is is Aila. With the myth of unbeaten Aila and Qubeley Papillon, how will Fellini fight with Wing Gundam Fenice?

Episode 21: Among the Sparking Particles
"What am I doing here?" - An encouter with Barthes. A scout. Forced battling. Endless training... There is no choice but to fight for me. Aila is reminiscing...

Anonymous Wed Feb 05 2014 14:00:22 No.10297322 ViewReport	
>>10297027

Well, the original Arashi manga is fully translated.

It's an interesting read. Of all Ishinomori's manga I've read, I think its hero is the most removed from his TV persona, despite still having many similarities. It's a strange story, less a tale of good vs. evil and more one man on a quest for revenge, with a killer twist at the end and a rather bleak message overall.

Here's the links for it:

http://www.mediafire.com/download/3dv373ge9jpn9r4/Henshin+Ninja+Arashi_v01.rar

http://www.mediafire.com/download/npl7gl9kbn54uct/Henshin+Ninja+Arashi_v02.rar	
GoogleiqdbSauceNAO 1391629121587.jpg, 142 kB, 476x634

or read online here: http://www.batoto.net/read/_/220349/gundam-build-fighters-a_ch1_by_newtype-of-world

not sure when ch2 will get copied over to other websites, but it was here first. js.

Gunpla General
Toot !!L9oQMjQE0Ck Wed Jan 29 2014 03:38:15 No.10258245 ViewReport	
***READ THE GUIDE***
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o
***READ THE GUIDE****

For those of you just joining us, please read this guide. I've done my best to answer basic and commonly asked questions. Please read it before asking questions as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "Plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model." If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here.

>"If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!"

***READ THE GUIDE***

IRC Channel
>Server
Rizon
>Channel
#gunpla

The guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/pub?id=1Tr8UyF2Xg5Ojqw0sxcO7oIG7IIsJPes3lMO5pHZKu5o

And a handy guide to other types of plamo:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

dorkly chair of the institute for space politics Sun Jan 26 2014 20:49:10 No.10240613 ViewReport	
>>10240585
Stitch In Time is way cool. But it needs a big warning about how it takes all the mystery out of Garak. Every shady story about his past he makes allusions to in the show is spelled out blow for blow in the book. If you want THE ANSWERS about Garak they're all there. But you may like him for the mysteries.

on the subject of ancillary Trek materials the old DC comics set between movies 2 and 3 are pretty cool. http://www.mediafire.com/folder/tcdq1of8bdjem/trek_comics

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO Toku Fandom's New Opinion on Gok (...).png, 685 kB, 1280x720
Anonymous Tue Jan 21 2014 23:40:29 No.10212954 ViewReport	
Here's a small thing I've been doing during free time, O-T's Gokaiger subs re-timed for BunnyHat's Bluray encodes along with futzing with the sub styles for a 720p video instead of the tiny ass RAWs they used before. If fonts are too small or whatever, oh well, I tried. Also touched up the dialogue just a little bit, mainly just making sure the earlier episodes referred to "Ooinaru Chikara" as "Ultimate Power" like O-T finally settled on for the series by episode 15.

So far I've only done up to episode 16, but that should be enough for now, since after 16 you're supposed to watch 199 Heroes to keep your fix going. Or... whatever.

https://www.mediafire.com/?xo83q4u4kf9z6ra

Backland Stride Motherfuckers!
Fivemarks Tue Jan 14 2014 22:40:54 No.10174000 ViewReport	
http://www.mediafire.com/view/kmwfvaiuekodpow/BacklandStridePreview.pdf
Here's some motherfucking GAME related content. And by Game Related, I mean I've come to give you /m/en a preview of Backland Stride, which includes the mechanics and character creation rules for the game, along with equipment and mecha customization.

Now, what is Backland Stride you ask? Well, I'll tell you sons of bitches what it is. Backland Stride is an in development Roleplaying Game set in the year 2625 in a small sector of space called the Cygnus Marche, more commonly known as the Cygnus Backlands. Shit is cyberpunk and transhuman as fuck: Almost everyone is genetically enhanced in some form or another, and cybernetic and nanomachine augmentations are as common as pharmaceutical drugs are today. Oh, and the universe is in the middle of a Cold War. That's kinda important: The Allied Stellar Compact, known as the Alliance, fought a ten year long war 35 years ago against a rival multinational organization known as the Collective. Now, neither of these groups are pretty and faultless, but the Collective are some heads up bad assholes. And we're not talking some bullshit Universal Century Gundam style "OH NO THE FEDERATION IS CORRUPT THAT MEANS THEY'RE EVIL WHILE ZEON IS SO NOBLE AND SHIT" This is some real straight up shit, motherfuckers. The Alliance is pretty corrupt and has it's fair share of self serving individuals but the Collective Practices slavery, some collective planets have a brutal version of the Hindu Caste System, one of their planets is just MuvLuv Japan in Space(Complete with Yamato Damashii and Racism), one is a conquered banana republic, and one is just straight up a eusocial all female planet.

But Fivemarks, you ask, What the fuck should I give a shit about Backland Stride and not something like Mekton, or Pheonix Command, Or some shitty System that uses Dark Heresy for mecha? I'll tell you why:

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO Hibiki.jpg, 41 kB, 853x480
Hibiki 01-16 Sun Jan 12 2014 23:56:44 No.10163391 ViewReport	
First third of Hibiki.

I went over TV-N's subs and tried to fix the mistakes I could found, comparing their script to the Japanese captions.
I can't guarantee that I haven't made mistakes myself. I'm far from perfect in Japanese.
Also, many lines are still identical to the original release.
It's not a perfect release, but it should still be a better alternative.

Here are patches
http://www.mediafire.com/?065doz475lbmc1b

For these raws
http://www.nyaa.se/?page=view&tid=440475

I'm really sorry if there are any mistakes.
You can make ddls or torrents of these episodes if you want.
Feel free to use the scripts if you want to make a new translation from scratch.

The files have two tracks
Track 1 uses Masked Rider, Ogre, Servant, Princess
Track 2 uses Kamen Rider, Oni, Douji, Hime
Both tracks have western name order, no honorifics, the word Makamou and the names of the Makamou left as-is.

Kamen Rider General 208: All you need is love edition
Anonymous Fri Jan 10 2014 22:49:22 No.10152887 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>10154662
I like how the big draw to the article is ''THE REASON WHY GAIM WAS DELAYED'', but the translation is wrong and has jack shit to do with why it started in Oct.

Translation in the article:
>Gaim was delayed one month, and started in October. This is because the power up item would clash with the first set of toys during Christmas. This meant I couldn’t introduce new items and characters until after that point.

Transcription of the original text:
1???????????
7????????????????????????????????
??????????????????????????????

Actual translation:
>The show started a month later than usual, so I had to introduce all the merchandise intended for the Christmas period by episode 7. The only thing I had time for in the beginning was showing those items and introducing all the characters.

Another victory for toku news sites!

>>10145252
I like how the big draw to the article is ''THE REASON WHY GAIM WAS DELAYED'', but the translation is wrong and has jack shit to do with why it started in Oct.

Translation in the article:
>Gaim was delayed one month, and started in October. This is because the power up item would clash with the first set of toys during Christmas. This meant I couldn’t introduce new items and characters until after that point.

Transcription of the original text:
1???????????
7????????????????????????????????
??????????????????????????????

Actual translation:
>The show started a month later than usual, so I had to introduce all the merchandise intended for the Christmas period by episode 7. The only thing I had time for in the beginning was showing those items and introducing all the characters.

Another victory for toku news sites!

Decals are to be applied over a glossy surface (buy a can of gloss topcoat) while the decal is wet.

Read this and help yourself: http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

http://www.mediafire.com/download/22jne362plcx6i4/WIP_fao+_M_.ipad.mp4

Here's how much I've done on this thing so far. There's some new bits in there and lots of old bits have been fixed up. I'm also traying to smooth out the narrative flow- for instance it doesn't just cut to asteroid dodging now. There's an establishing shot before it. I'll be going through and doing that for any bits which seem out of place, and then actually sticking an ending on it.

Throw your criticisms at me, constructive or otherwise! Though I'm going to be having a shower and eating stuff and possibly falling asleep so I might have to address stuff tomorrow if I just pass out.

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO amwspecxlarge[1].jpg, 211 kB, 456x640
Anonymous Tue Dec 10 2013 15:38:57 No.10008068 ViewReport	
I found this the other day: Airfix Model World Special / Scale Modeling Step-by-Step.
From all the documents I have, this is the best guide for complete beginners. It covers tools, assembly, types of paint, normal and airbrushes, decalling, weathering. There's nothing in particular for gunpla (which rarely appears in model magazines), but all of the techniques apply.

Yes, it's a PDF file. However, it's an official release, not a scan: it has fully searchable text

http://www.mediafire.com/view/1vf1aw7v91pz5pa/Airfix%20Model%20World%20Specia%20(Scale%20Modelling%20Step-By-Step).pdf

Co/m/r/a/des sing !!nhfhP2XhJPB Wed Dec 04 2013 00:42:45 No.9976344 ViewReport	
Friendly reminder that I've started accepting recordings for /m/ and /a/ Muv Luv singing collaboration. The song list is:
Muv-Luv;
I Will;
Song from the distant Earth;
Asu e no Houkou;
Carry On;
Tsubasa;
Saigo no Eden;
Sora wo Yuku Tomoshibi no Uta (TDA ED).

All songs will be compiled into a medley, as well as uploaded separately. The deadline is Christmas, and I hope to upload the everything on Youtube by the New Year.

Link to archives with lyrics and off-vocal tracks: http://www.mediafire.com/?6jlk070m0yui3
Send your recordings to: masingsmuvluv@gmail.com
If you don't see me do it myself, please repost this in future threads. Thanks.
Bring Stabity Wed Dec 04 2013 00:40:34 No.9976334 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>9976505
>>9976200
>I'll probably just take screen shots of all the occasions where this happens up to Stage 17
Please don't, that doesn't help us.

Whenever you find a untranslated line:
1. Save state
2. Turn on "Dump Textures"
3. Load state. (yes this is important, don't skip this step.
4. press "b, a, a"
5. repeat step 4 until you run out of untranslated lines.
6. Fire up the texture organizer.
7. Organize the textures.
8. Upload the textures (MF is a great choice because it lets me copy your contribution over to my folder without having to download and upload).
9. Post your progress here.

Also, I just noticed that we have the female super route dumped up to stage 10.
https://www.mediafire.com/folder/2h7n3hhv26m4c/Female%20Super

View SameGoogleiqdbSauceNAO 1r[1].jpg, 239 kB, 997x1440
Another Century Chronicle
Anonymous Sun Dec 01 2013 15:38:20 No.9963314 ViewReport	
More uploads. This time is the Another Century Chronicle books, a compendium on the One Year War. Quoting HLJ:
>Included are a detailed history guide to the beginning and ending of the One Year War, Zeon operations and campaigns undertaken during the war, and information on the mobile suits, vehicles, warships, and weaponry used. Gorgeous realistic illustrations of the characters and mobile suits are found throughout the book
While the text is in Japanese, the maps are great. It has some magnificent illustrations as well of both Zeon and EF equipment.

Since it's in Japanese reading order, you need to read the files from the bottom up so the pages match.

Yes, these are PDFs too. Stop complaining. Be sure to activate "Show Cover Page During Two-Up" for the two-page spreads I had to apply Lanczos sampling to the original JPGs to equalize the page heights, which were all over the place in the original download, plus leaving the BW pages in grayscale. The PDFs themselves do not, again, DO NOT, have any further compression

http://www.mediafire.com/view/78loamnac2w371h/Another%20Century%20Chronicle%2C%20One%20Year%20War%20UC%200079-0080%20-%20Volume%20I.pdf

Friendly reminder that I've started accepting recordings for /m/ and /a/ Muv Luv singing collaboration. The song list is:
Muv-Luv;
I Will;
Song from the distant Earth;
Asu e no Houkou;
Carry On;
Tsubasa;
Saigo no Eden;

Send your recordings to: masingsmuvluv@gmail.com
If you don't see me do it myself, please repost this in future threads. Thanks.

/m/ Soundtrack 15 + A bit of news
Bernard Wiseman !5vxZSjZKP6 Mon Nov 25 2013 17:57:45 No.9938999 ViewReport	
Another month means yet another /m/ Soundtrack. Bringing in the hip beats of new shows like Build Fighters and Space Dandy, along with some old classics by JAM project and Aniki, Album 15 is here! You can grab it here:
https://www.mediafire.com/?95hj514kr75nyqi

You can also grab the other albums here:
http://msoundtrack.tumblr.com/

Now for some info on what's happening with these things. The basis for the next five themed albums are set in stone at this point. A bunch of tracks for each album are also in place. The only one that's still not set in stone is the /m/'s Top 30 album. And that's where you all come in. (cont.)

Danball Senki BOOST translation
CrashmanX !!GAKnwBRBYtV Tue Nov 19 2013 21:57:28 No.9912474 ViewReport	
So if anyone actually cares anymore here's all the work I did on Danball BOOST.
I stopped working on it about 3 months ago. I've lost just about all interest in the games and series. With it also announced as being localized, at least the anime, I've lost a huge drive to do it because that means the games will be coming out in english.

What's translated:
Lots of menus. All the parts names. Pretty much all the items. A bunch of the errors. All kinds of various things. Just a ton of stuff overall.
What's not translated:
Story. Multiplayer menus. Menus that I missed.
Stuff that I didn't get to.

Will I continue work:
Maybe? I dunno. I'll gladly provide tools/resources if anyone wishes to continue my work. The game is fully translation capable and there's tools to make it very easy if you're interested.

Instructions are included in the ReadMe.
http://www.mediafire.com/download/4lwcijadx1taodd/Danball+Senki+BOOST+patch.zip	
Anonymous Tue Nov 19 2013 21:15:15 No.9912152 ViewReport

Enjoy how everyone in the thread will now bitch about Hasegawa character designs. Now one of you fuckers translate it.
(Not the V sidestory, that's been done already)

Now with even more shameless OP pasting action!

Previous thread (#9):
>>9787964

All you need to know (links, installing, troubleshooting, etc):
http://pastebin.com/CYDquvFD

IMPORTANT: This now works on Dolphin 4.0.

Folder containing the stuff we've done:
mediafire.com/srwgc

PDF explaining how this works and how to use the tools for translating: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rzlnrnogfzw7kk6/SRW%20GC%20Translation%20Toolkit%20Tutorial.zip

Demo Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=93IHK2DraFE

Progress so far: Roughly 25%.

Menus translated up to mission 25. (Up to 20 is available, right now.)
Stages translated up to mission 17.
Battle lines translated up to mission 10(?).

You can blame Dunbine and i, Dolores for my lack of progress.

co/m/r/a/des sing !!nhfhP2XhJPB Sat Nov 16 2013 01:54:29 No.9894109 ViewReport	
Friendly reminder that I've started accepting recordings for /m/ and /a/ singing collaboration. The final song list is:
"Muv-Luv";
"I Will";
"Song from the distant Earth";
"Asu e no Houkou";
"Carry On";
"Tsubasa"
"Saigo no Eden";
"Sora wo Yuku Kibou no Uta" (TDA ED).
All songs will be compiled into a medley, as well as uploaded separately. I don't know if I'll include TDA songs in the main video, though, it will depend on how many people choose to sing them.

The deadline is Christmas. I hope to upload the covers by the New Year.

Link to archives with lyrics and off-vocal tracks: http://www.mediafire.com/?6jlk070m0yui3
Send your recordings to: masingsmuvluv@gmail.com
If you don't see me do it myself, please repost this in future threads. Thanks.

>>9878745
Sorry for the wait, everyone. My computer crashed when downloading some shit last night and the uploads didn't get completed.

The Mediafire link has all the Top Ten books (that I'm aware of). Reading order would be Top Ten/Top Ten: The 49ers, Smax, and then Top Ten: Beyond the Farthest Precinct.

Beyond the Farthest Precinct has a bit more Joe Pi, but he's criminally underused. Smax isn't /m/, but it's a fun read. The 49ers is basically "Have some gorgeous fucking art, some aerial combat scenes, and robots vs. vampires".

co/m/r/a/des sing !!nhfhP2XhJPB Sat Nov 16 2013 01:54:29 No.9894109 ViewReport	
Friendly reminder that I've started accepting recordings for /m/ and /a/ singing collaboration. The final song list is:
"Muv-Luv";
"I Will";
"Song from the distant Earth";
"Asu e no Houkou";
"Carry On";
"Tsubasa"
"Saigo no Eden";
"Sora wo Yuku Kibou no Uta" (TDA ED).
All songs will be compiled into a medley, as well as uploaded separately. I don't know if I'll include TDA songs in the main video, though, it will depend on how many people choose to sing them.

The deadline is Christmas. I hope to upload the covers by the New Year.

Link to archives with lyrics and off-vocal tracks: http://www.mediafire.com/?6jlk070m0yui3
Send your recordings to: masingsmuvluv@gmail.com
If you don't see me do it myself, please repost this in future threads. Thanks.

Anonymous Sat Oct 26 2013 04:59:27 No.9810980 ViewReport	
>>9810543
>>9810499

http://www.mediafire.com/view/dx8g1cj43bc8w1b/SRW_rules.pdf

this isn't a complete game, it's a tweak for PDQ Truth and Justice.

Basically your character gets ranks of Attributes and ranks of "tangibles" which are item-based attributes that can be taken away. This adds another category, "Unit Tangibles" which are specifically for the mech meaning they only work after launching. Characters gain a set amount of chips, which are basically action points. In vanilla TnG you just spend those to get a +2 on any roll. In this, I've added specific chip abilities instead which are basically Super Robot Wars seishins.
Bring Stabity Fri Oct 25 2013 22:59:27 No.9810067 ViewReport

R/HAIR/dio
Rocketeer_Tille Mon Oct 21 2013 21:40:52 No.9793152 ViewReport	
It's that time of the week again!

This week, we're taking a trip to the 1980s, a time of rollerskating, hair metal, and prog rock. Also lolis and really hilarious fashion styles. Sometimes both together.

Put any songs you'd like to request for 80's under HAIR. We'll be doing 25 of those. I.E. Dragonar, Nadesico, Layzner, ZZ. You know the drill. (not the piercing one, face on chest one, or dinosaur fucking one, those are different drills)

Anything else can go under SHENANIGANS, which will be the other 25. Shenanigans will be kind of like the normal block, but less topical, more silly, and possibly stuff that may or may not actually sound like music and/or sound pleasing. I'll be doing it near the end. Word of note: I'm letting you guys request virtually anything for shenanigans. I'll decide whether or not to play it, but you can do anything. I'll TRY to keep it /m/ related, but we'll see.

Show starts at 7PM PST, 10PM EST, 2AM GMT.

MP3s of the last two songs should hopefully be showing in the MEGA folder by the time the show starts. Mediafire says my files are too large for them, so they aren't an option.
https://mega.co.nz/#F!yIJRED4C!DIri4ThrUXVEkIrKZbvOoA

Oppai-Missile Mon Oct 14 2013 17:45:39 No.9763140 ViewReport	
mediafire.com/download/7l4zxah3zo197a6/Stage_16_eng.7z

Here's stage 16. This stage gave us Sieg and Sally's full names as well as the names of a couple more original characters. They're all made up alien names, so the romanization can be tricky. The only source I found is this jap wiki at wiki.cre.jp/SRW, so for now I'm going by what it says. It seems consistent with most of the names we know, though some seem a bit weird (????? as "Helluga" doesn't seem quite right to me), but I don't really have a better plan for it.
Also, I guess it's fine to call people from Gadisword "Gadiswordians"? It's annoying having to work all lines to say "from Gadisword" instead, using a demonym often sounds better.

Bring, did you miss the dialogue between Sieg and Sally that happens during the stage? It triggered when I attacked a random grunt with Akimi, so it seems kinda hard to miss. I dumped it myself though, no problem. It wasn't too long.

what I do is run the BNO launcher through applocale with the JP lanaugage pack installed

use this
http://www.mediafire.com/download/ekuca5246za6qy1/HF+pAppLoc.rar

install and when it's done open mudfish first then right click the BNO launcher shortcut, and "run with japanese applocale as admin"

should fix the problem

>>9748398
The months after were worse.
>Everyone uploading stuff to Filesonic and wupload
>They both go down the crapper almost instantly because of paranoia so now all you can find are dead links for everything unless you spend hours looking on Google.
>Multiupload goes down the crapper
>Mediafire gets way paranoid and now deletes pretty much anything they can.
>All those sties blocking you from downloading anything you didn't upload
>Sites blocking anyone from the US.
Somehow, Rapidshare got better, and I don't know how. I still remember how they limited free users to 10KB/s and you could only download one file a day, then it was 50KB/s but unlimited downloads, and now I think it's unrestricted.

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO Mars_010_00.jpg, 245 kB, 959x1497
DYNAMO JOE
Thundernon Mon Oct 07 2013 15:16:33 No.9734002 ViewReport	
Hey, /m/. Miss me?

I meant to throw this up a month ago, but it didn't quite happen due to sudden unemployment issues. But I'm here now. So here we have it, by request, Dynamo Joe! Brought to us in the mid 1980s by First Comics, it features the writing talents of the talented John Ostrander and, later, Phil Foglio. (Unfortunately, Foglio doesn't do art, so we don't get any of his voluptuous vixens.) It's one of the first (I won't say the first period, because I don't know) original American mecha comics.

I haven't read a lot of it but it's real short. I'll probably get through it with you guys in about two days. Maybe three. The basic plot is that three civilizations (that didn't get on well anyway) are being invaded by another group of aliens that forces them to team up.

And giant robots are involved.

For those of you who missed all of my Zoids UK posts, you can find them http://www.mediafire.com/folder/5yk539mbzt8kk/Zoids plus a few side-features and one-shots that I didn't storytime.

I've also still got ROM and Shogun Warriors up if anyone needs them.

MSPaint guy !9rR20beZpQ Mon Sep 30 2013 07:39:54 No.9703792 ViewReport	
LAST TIME ON /m/ DRAWS SOME MECHA,

- G GUNDAM WINS BY A VOTE THANKS TO DYNAMIC IPS
- ANON RELEASES HIS FANTASTIC SHIN MAZINGER MS PAINT OPENING (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vWUm86GraaA) AND KEEPS MY THREAD BUMPED
- AND WE NEED TO GET OUR SHIT TOGETHER AND VOTE DRAGONAR NEXT TIME SO WE CAN KEEP GETTING SUBS

But enough about that, time for the G Gundam screencaps! You will find them here, at http://imgur.com/a/g0iXh#0

If you don't have it and wish to use the wonderful XP Paint, I've uploaded it here for your pleasure: http://www.mediafire.com/download/z9h9fypt9obnj23/mspaint_xp.exe

So here's how we should go about this in a nice orderly way:
- Check out the imgur link and choose one or two images to reserve at a time (No more than 2 please!)
- Choosing two images that go together (eg 1 and 2) is fine but by no means expected
- If there's a frame I didn't cap and you want to draw it, let me know! Otherwise,
- Note the numbers and check the thread to make sure they haven't been taken
-If they haven't, go ahead and post in the thread to indicate they're reserved
- YOU GET TO DRAWING
- Images should be 1280x720 pngs (or prepare to get rescaled)
- If you want a sprite animated separately from the background, draw the sprite separately and make it transparent in photoshop
- Email me when you're done at mdrawsmecha@gmail.com with instructions (if necessary) as to how you want the frame animated
- I'll leave it up to you as to whether you want to post your progress and/or finished frames in the thread, but my preference is to keep things a surprise until the video is done!

I'll update the list every so often. Any questions/comments etc just post in the thread or email me if you want it a secret. MOST IMPORTANTLY: HAVE FUN WITH THIS!

70's & 80's Mecha Thread - Rocket Punch Edition
Anonymous Wed Sep 25 2013 08:53:29 No.9683291 ViewReport	
The last 70's and 80's mecha thread have reached it's image limit and is unable to fill its purpose. So, we'll let him rest in peace and summon this new 70's & 80's mecha thread in order to keep the legacy going. If you weren't there when it was still in a good shape, just check the last thread here : >>9581226 and get all the stuff you can before it go away for the eternity, forcing you to dig in various archives...

Most of you already know the rules, right? If not, here's what this thread is for: argue, discuss and dump stuff like artworks, fanarts (if they're well made of course), sketches, magazines' scans, artbooks, DVD/VHS/LD/CD/BD's covers, ads, musics, screencaps and so on, that have a link to a Sci-Fi and Mecha anime/comic/novel/film/OVA.

Here are a few links to interesting websites:

Dirty Pair/Lovely Angel's Shrine : http://web.archive.org/web/20050403060228/http://igarashi.burst.net/dp/dp.htm

Studio Jipang's Work : http://www001.upp.so-net.ne.jp/jipang/kei/index.html

The DEATHKING webpage (it has a few /m/ stuff that are worth seeing) : http://www.h4.dion.ne.jp/~general/

Daitarn 3 shrine : http://www.oasidelleanime.com/minisiti/daitarn3/index.htm
(check the rest of the website to get a whole bunch of pictures from various /m/ and not so /m/ shows)

The then promised SDF Macross - Best Hit Series part. 1 : http://www.mediafire.com/download/3dye5o032al0zjn

And here is the second part : http://www.mediafire.com/download/2r6z01m7ahcll28
(yes I'm still dumping the Macross book, as many anons were interested in it, and I made them wait longer than they should have...)

Anonymous Tue Sep 17 2013 01:24:51 No.9650594 ViewReport	
Hey everyone, I had asked yesterday in the previous thread if anyone had translated the Heisei Rider novels, and it looked like no one has yet. Whether that's because of a lack of source or maybe translating is too much effort, that's fine. I understand that translating takes a lot of time and can be boring and I don't want to be ungrateful/take people for granted.

But I bought the Kamen Rider W novel, and unfortunately, I can't read Japanese. But I wanted to be able to put the raws out there, just in case anyone was interested in translating, or maybe if there are people who know how to read Japanese and don't feel like getting the book but are interested.

Here's the link: http://www.mediafire.com/?753kyz5o5fygml8

Just a few notes:
- Hopefully I didn't miss any pages, I took them all as screenshots on my phone since I couldn't figure out how to extract the actual Kindle file from my phone. (I tried to go into the phone's Kindle directory, but it wasn't in the eBooks folder.)
- Some pages are duplicates, because when I lost track of the page I was on, I would go into Photos to double check, and go back to the Kindle app and for some reason it'd push the page a line back, so I just took two photos of it.
- When you open the zip/folder, it should be sorted like 1, 2, 3... etc. If not, sort it by date.

Anyway, if someone would be willing to translate it, that'd be great! If not, that's fine too!

Thundernon Mon Sep 09 2013 20:44:10 No.9617065 ViewReport	
And it stops here.

ZOIDS was cancelled with this issue half-way completed. There was no monthly. There was no end to this series. If you want complete stories, look at the Japanese stuff.

The crew of the Celeste never got off Zoidstar.

The Corporation is sending troops to capture Zoids and bring them to Earth as war machines.

Zoidzilla is possibly dead, with no Blue Zoid capable of taking over leadership.

Red Horn is in command and genocidal.

The Namer will never see an end to the war that destroyed his planet and many others.

Also, all comics are uploading to http://www.mediafire.com/folder/5yk539mbzt8kk/Zoids

Tomorrow, if I do one tomorrow and if it downloads in time, we'll have Dynamo Joe.

Anonymous Sun Sep 08 2013 23:00:28 No.9613151 ViewReport	
>>9613138
The rars are split into two volumes because they're too big to be uploaded onto mediafire as one rar file. Like any split archive, you have to download all of the parts in order to extract the files.

So for example,
Getter Robo Arc Volume 1.part1
Getter Robo Arc Volume 1.part2

You need both of these files to extract
Getter Robo Arc Volume 1
Anonymous Sun Sep 08 2013 22:54:40 No.9613115 ViewReport	
http://www.mediafire.com/?f6d536dxeq58f

REVENGE OF THE SHOGUN WARRIORS
Thundernon Thu Sep 05 2013 12:52:32 No.9595347 ViewReport	
LAST TIME ON SHOGUN WARRIORS:
A giant preying mantis from space showed up out of nowhere and killed the Followers of the Light! Now, with no tech support or guidance from the benevolent group, the Shogun Warriors are on their own. But at least they managed to wrap up a loose end from Marvel's Godzilla series, right?

Will they turn to SHIELD, the world's anti-espionage organization? The Fantastic Four? Maybe the Avengers?

No, instead they're gonna hide their robots where some punk kid can find one and pilot it. This sounds like the opening scene to an anime. Possibly even to one of the shows the comic takes the mechs from.

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO Shogun Warriors #1 {Comixbear}-01.jpg, 973 kB, 1173x1814
SHOGUN WARRIORS
Thundernon Tue Sep 03 2013 15:51:03 No.9586991 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>9591647
Hi, /m/. Did you miss me?

As promised after I did ROM, I bring you the SHOGUN WARRIORS.

A bit of history: In the 1970s Mattel somehow got their hands on a bunch of anime and decided to make toys of them. The robots they got were renamed and poorly made by today's standards, requiring disassembly for transformations and sometimes even parts from other toys that weren't released in America.

In 1979, perhaps after seeing the success of ROM, GREATEST OF THE SPACEKNIGHTS, Mattel approached Marvel about doing a comic book series based on three of the Shogun Warriors: Raydeen, Combattra, and Dangard Ace. Marvel agreed and a 20-issue story followed.

So here we go.

Oh, and if you missed ROM, all of his comics are up in http://www.mediafire.com/folder/1ivvjpjjvcl7o/ROM

MSV-R Return of Johnny Ridden ch 16
Nozaku Mon Sep 02 2013 16:16:03 No.9582170 ViewReport	
Here is chapter 16 for Return of Johnny Ridden. The previous translations appeared to be from Gundam Ace, whereas this one was the final chapter from volume 3, so included are cover pages, extras, etc. A big thanks to AngryAnon for the scans.

http://www.mediafire.com/download/h9hxa4yktk13vc8/Mobile_Suit_Gundam_MSV-R_Johnny_Raiden_no_Kikan_v3ch16.zip

This update was a single chapter to finish off volume 3 but expect future updates for MSV-R to be in volumes (that take more time to prepare). (oh and I know "Raiden" is misspelled in the file names before someone mentions it, it's just too much work to fix every individual file name at this point).

So, I have 3 weeks before I leave to Japan. I am still looking for kind /m/en who are willing to help me with shopping (cleaning, blanking and text-shopping) and uploading while I'm there for a year.

Also, while I'm in Japan, are there any (single-volume) mangas I should be on the lookout for?
GoogleiqdbSauceNAO 80smechathreadneo02.png, 63 kB, 800x600
70's & 80's Mecha Thread - Rebirth part #2
Anonymous Mon Sep 02 2013 11:25:09 No.9581226 ViewReport	
A few days after the birth of the last 80's and 70's mecha thread, the feared moment finally arrived: The image limit have been reached. But let's not give in to despair, here come brand new 70's & 80's mecha thread to keep the legacy going! For those who weren't present on the last thread, here it is: >>9535324 . Just go there and hog around before it disappear, forcing you to check out the archives.

Most of you already know the rules, right? If not, here's what this thread is for: argue, discuss and dump stuff like artworks, fanarts (if they're well made of course), sketches, magazines' scans, artbooks, DVD/VHS/LD/CD/BD's covers, ads, musics, screencaps and so on, that have a link to a Sci-Fi and Mecha anime/comic/novel/film/OVA.

Here are a few links to interesting websites:

Dirty Pair/Lovely Angel's Shrine : http://web.archive.org/web/20050403060228/http://igarashi.burst.net/dp/dp.htm

Studio Jipang's Work : http://www001.upp.so-net.ne.jp/jipang/kei/index.html

The DEATHKING webpage (it has a few /m/ stuff that are worth seeing) : http://www.h4.dion.ne.jp/~general/

Daitarn 3 shrine : http://www.oasidelleanime.com/minisiti/daitarn3/index.htm

The promised SDF Macross - Best Hit Series part. 1 : http://www.mediafire.com/download/3dye5o032al0zjn

And here is the second part : http://www.mediafire.com/download/2r6z01m7ahcll28

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO 80smechathreadneo.png, 60 kB, 800x600
the return of the 70's & 80's Mecha Thread
Anonymous Fri Aug 23 2013 10:08:24 No.9535324 ViewReport	
A few weeks ago, the 70's & 80's mecha thread got pruned after a long inactivity, and as it didn't have any successor no, one ever heard of it again... But now, it is time for the new 70's & 80's mecha thread to take his place and shine!

For those of you who don't know what to do in this thread, here are some things you can do: argue, discuss and dump stuff like artworks, fanarts (if they're well made of course), sketches, magazines' scans, artbooks, DVD/VHS/LD/CD/BD's covers, ads, musics, screencaps and so on, that have a link to a Sci-Fi and Mecha anime/comic/novel/film/OVA.

Here are some useful links:
Archive of the 12th edition of the 70's & 80's /m/ thread : https://archive.foolz.us/m/thread/9430117/
Archive of the 11th edition of the 70's & 80's /m/ thread : https://archive.foolz.us/m/thread/9330069/
Super Dimension Fortress Macross - Best Hit Series part. 1 : http://www.mediafire.com/download/3dye5o032al0zjn
Super Dimension Fortress Macross - Best Hit Series part. 2 : http://www.mediafire.com/download/2r6z01m7ahcll28
Toshihiro Hirano - Character Works : http://www.mediafire.com/download/6j5n6l1tmhj3ttv
Studio Jipang Works : http://www001.upp.so-net.ne.jp/jipang/kei/index.html
Dirty Pair/Lovely Angel's Shrine : http://web.archive.org/web/20050403060228/http://igarashi.burst.net/dp/dp.htm

He's about 36 now. He's a fairly famous voice actor too. Off the top of my head he was Kane in Bodacious Space Pirates, Blues in Rockman.EXE, Matsuba (Morty) in Pokemon, Ballad Hunter in Zoids New Century, and, the best one, Pirihiko Ichimonji in Zettai Hero Project for the PSP. As for Sentai, besides Mega, he was in Hurricanger as one of Shurikenger's disguises, he was the previous Lord in Shinkenger, and he was Gokumaru in Go-Onger.

Here's a nice video of him breaking into other voice actors hotel rooms, waking them up, and seeing how long it takes for them to say a line of one of their characters.

Anonymous Tue Aug 20 2013 03:31:01 No.9520146 ViewReport	
>>9520067
Use dice for everything. For storys have a pre-established plot line and have the game master introduce conflict between characters, reward players for having characters with backgrounds that specify unique personality and life style traits, ala, specifying your character is an alcoholic with bounty hunters after him because he crashed his ship into a mafia wedding on accident years ago or what have you.

Model your RP after established, high quality RPG systems that have been tried and put to the test. Adapting mecha, robot skills and so on is simple and shouldn't be much trouble.

Tried and true DnD is a good option, if you're looking for something online friendly and a bit more simple, try The Returners, it's an excellent RP system originally made for final fantasy but easily adjustable for /m/ format. You can find the core book here:
http://www.mediafire.com/view/?xaw5istqdhjc1ch

Remember, a competent game master with a -DETAILED PLAN- FOR THE RP'S PLOT AND ACTIVITIES, with a focus on story telling is KEY. "5 Zakus appear. Roll for initiative." is absolute utter shit.

"As you pass through the massive ship graveyard, you are all rocked back by the force of a nearby derelict ship erupting into a brilliant explosion. As your eyes adjust from the blinding flash of light, the form of several Zaku space type mobile suits rocket from behind the shattered carcass of the dead Starship. The leader of the enemy squadron points his Zaku's atuo-cannon at you and prepares to fire... Roll for initiative...." - THIS is how you narrate NPC combat. Structure, setting, plot. Those three things = good times.

>>9519918

So, you know, that being the case, we think it'd be really awesome if you just stopped breathing. Please consider doing the world a favor, you'll be like a hero or something! Thanks.

I'm going to put it to you straight. There isn't any animated BT except for a saturday morning cartoon in the '90s. The main way you get the universe is by reading the books that have been coming out for 30 years. I'm not going to lie, it's not for everyone. It's hard to get started, honestly. But it's damn cool, because no other fictional work is quite this detailed.
>>>/tg/26583092 knows more about it than I

I'm going to put it to you straight. There isn't any animated BT except for a saturday morning cartoon in the '90s. The main way you get the universe is by reading the books that have been coming out for 30 years. I'm not going to lie, it's not for everyone. It's hard to get started, honestly. But it's damn cool, because no other fictional work is quite this detailed.
>>>/tg/26583092 knows more about it than I

Anonymous Sun Aug 04 2013 22:14:13 No.9455104 ViewReport	
>>9455087
>>9455087
And that's it.

For the last time, all issues are at http://www.mediafire.com/folder/1ivvjpjjvcl7o/ROM

ROM would appear again when Rick Jones was married, as a guest at the wedding.

There was a shortlived series in the 2000s where ROM, now Prime Director of Galador and renamed Artour, appeared. The ship he was on was destroyed, yet no body was ever found. This would be the last time he ever made an appearance.

The Spaceknights continued, though they may all be dead now thanks to Hickman's need to treat everyone like Worf to show how tough his new villains are.

If /m/ likes, I'll continue tomorrow with Marvel's SHOGUN WARRIORS. It really depends on if /m/ wants to read about the adventures of Combattra, Dangaurd Ace, and Raydeen. If you want it, ask.

Until then, though... Well, I hope you enjoyed the series.

Today we stand a good chance of finishing the series off.

What happened last time?

VICTORY! With the aid of the heroes of Earth, and Beta Ray Bill, ROM has exterminated the Dire Wraith threat on Earth! And, further, he has destroyed the source of their foul magics, rendering any survivors across the galaxy utterly powerless to carry out their schemes! Truly, ROM is the greatest of the Spaceknights.

Now the silver-clad guardian of Galador returns to the stars, searching for a place he might call... Home.

ROM 12: The Reboot
Thundernon Sat Aug 03 2013 14:39:48 No.9448398 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>9452581
The last time we left ROM, Brandy Clark, in the body of Starshine, was growing worse. She had lost the humanity that ROM loved her for and became more like his old friend, the Terminator. However, the half Dire Wraith mutant known as Hybrid stripped her of her armor, her power, and turned her into a human for the purpose of bearing his children! With the aid of the New Mutants, ROM was able to stop his plan, but Brandy's injuries were critical.

Meanwhile, SHIELD and the UN have been cracking down on Dire Wraith activity throughout the world. There are very few left, but now the Wraiths have activated their final plan for victory...

Can ROM: GREATEST OF THE SPACEKNIGHTS foil their fiendish plan? Will he finally end his two hundred year old war? Or is ROM going to meet with more disappointment?

Come and see the final chapters of ROM: SPACEKNIGHT, under the talented pens of Bill Mantlo and Steve Ditko. We are at issue 61 of 75.

All previous issues may be found http://www.mediafire.com/folder/1ivvjpjjvcl7o/ROM

ROM 10: Nemesis
Thundernon Wed Jul 31 2013 20:36:16 No.9436657 ViewReport	
Let me apologize for my lack of presence. It's been a hard time at work. Still, I'm back, if exhausted, and I'm ready to bring you...

ROM! GREATEST OF THE SPACEKNIGHTS!

The last time we left ROM, Brandy had been given the body and powers of Starshine, Spaceknight of Galador and the Wielder of the Living Light, through Dire Wraith sorcery.

The females of the Dire Wraiths turned on and executed the males for their incompetence and reliance on technology over sorcery. Following this, they returned to the town of Clairton and murdered most of the population. The female Dire Wraiths don't just assume the forms like their male counterparts had, they jab their tongues into their victim's brain, suck out their memory and life force, and leave nothing but a dried husk behind.

Their treachery revealed, much of Clairton was destroyed in the purge that followed. Most of the population was dead. In her grief, Brandy cast aside any illusions of her remaining humanity and transformed into a golden gladiatrix to wreak havoc upon the aliens that destroyed her life.

And now we join them again, fresh from the tragedy.

Oh and, as always, all previous issues have been uploaded to http://www.mediafire.com/folder/1ivvjpjjvcl7o/ROM

Anonymous Sat Jul 27 2013 11:38:35 No.9418850 ViewReport	
I absolutely hate how TV-N likes to pretend they're helping people learn Japanese with their crap subs but never do anything to actually aid people in it (like making fucking soft subs, for starters).

While cleaning out some old files on my computer I found these, which are the original Japanese captions for the shows, and I thought they might help some people out if they're actually trying to learn Japanese.
As they are they don't synch with O-T's raws (don't know about BunnyHat's), but you can use http://subshifter.bitsnbites.eu/ this site to re-synch them to fit any raw you might have.

>Kamen Rider Kuuga (1-50, HBV, New Years Special)
http://www.mediafire.com/download/lltqlharuq74fxq/Kamen_Rider_Kuuga_captions_%5B01-50_%2B_HBV_%2B_New_Years_Special%5D.zip

>Kamen Rider 555 (1-50, Paradise Lost)
http://www.mediafire.com/download/d6ueirmnk9njdsg/Kamen_Rider_555_captions_%5B1-50_%2B_Paradise_Lost%5D.rar

>Kamen Rider Blade (1-49)
http://www.mediafire.com/download/4u285o1o3bhk0ys/Kamen_Rider_Blade_captions_%5B1-49%5D.zip

>Kamen Rider Fourze (1-48)
http://www.mediafire.com/download/7g2iix9pppq6i3w/Kamen_Rider_Fourze_captions_%5B1-48%5D.zip

I know I have more, I'll upload them later when I find them.

mediafire.com/download/lu5my9jd2cx7721/Stages_01_to_10b_QC'd.7z

Okay, I added Bring's latest suggestions so here's the batch of event dialogue for all stages up to 10b QC'd (let's just hope I didn't mess up and save an older version or anything). That's just the text files, though I included batches for each stage so it should be simple to generate the textures with the tool so we can put them together with Dash's battle dialogues and Steve's menu stuff for the first big batch.

I also included stages 01 to 02b of the male/super route (the files/folders tagged with "MS"), which I translated a while ago from the textures ripped by Guy G. I think we probably shouldn't include those in this batch though, since explaining how to avoid the conflicts would cause confusion that's not worth it for so little material.

Bernard Wiseman !5vxZSjZKP6 Wed Jul 24 2013 13:42:03 No.9404846 ViewReport	
After a week of delays and final tune-ups, the first /m/ soundtrack in over 6 months is finally out! I'm putting a hold on "themed" albums for now and just releasing several tracks that should have been in these soundtracks ages ago (Looking at you, Uninstall). Think of it as trying to go back to the roots of the original soundtracks.

Volume 11 can be downloaded here: http://www.mediafire.com/?9689cackm06q97s/

As always any recommendations or ideas for future songs/albums are welcome, and encouraged.

What do you need the tracklist for? If it's to find the songs, you can just grab the soundtrack from here:

http://www.mediafire.com/?soj9o4sma79fojh

If it's about getting the names of the songs, well, you can wait for them to be translated in the game.

>>9391830
Pretty much like a classic SRW (like J, for example) but now robots have components ala Front Mission (head, body, arms, legs) that can be destroyed individually to cause different penalties on units and CAPTURE them for use or sell.

No squads, no pilot point customization, no branching paths (but you have subscenarios that can be played over and over), no SR points. Read the FAQ for more details (in gamefaqs).

Also, I don't think this is the thread to look for someone to sprite pacific rim bots, please try somewhere else.

ROM 7: GENERATIONS
Thundernon Thu Jul 18 2013 18:27:03 No.9376193 ViewReport	
ROM! GREATEST OF THE SPACEKNIGHTS! The Silver Guardian of Galador, turned into an immortal cyborg in order to fight off the foul Dire Wraiths, has finally freed the town of Clairton of their vile menace. The cost, however, was high. With grief in his heart, he left to purge Earth of the alien menace posed by his foes.

His travels have taken him to Scotland and then to Atlantis, where he has teamed up with Namor to battle his sorcerous foes.

Armed with his mighty Neutralizer, a device capable of neutralizing any energy and banishing the Dire Wraiths to eternal torment in the hell-dimension of Limbo, he continues his two century war against his sworn enemies.

There is no previous thread. It is dead. Long live the thread!

Previously storytimed issues can be found http://www.mediafire.com/folder/1ivvjpjjvcl7o/ROM	
Anonymous Wed Jul 17 2013 22:53:53 No.9371129 ViewReport	
Okay, I got this working on my PSP. Here's what I did:

- Download both pkg files and this: http://www.mediafire.com/download/8dmg459mz36i3bh/PSN.PKG.Decryptor.%26.Extractor.v1.73.FULL-LMAN.rar
- Run the pkg decryptor, load the pkg files, select "Extract then (Decrypt, Dump) for PSP" and run it
- There will be 2 folders: one with the ISO and one with addon files.
- Put the ISO in your iso folder and the addon files in PSP/GAMES/NPJH50521

GREATEST OF THE SPACEKNIGHTS! in order to fight the deadly Dire Wraiths, shapeshifting masters of evil, sorcery, and science. Having defended Galador from their threat, Rom spent 200 years banishing their race to the hell-dimension of Limbo, where none can die, slaughtering them wherever he could find them. Including Earth. ROM 2
Thundernon Fri Jul 12 2013 17:12:48 No.9340961 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>9345595
ROM! GREATEST OF THE SPACEKNIGHTS!

Introduced in 1979 as a comic based on a rather craptacular toy! Brought to /m/ yesterday!

The Galadorian hero, transformed into a cybernetic super-warrior to fight off the evil Dire Wraiths! He has come to Earth and finds himself feared by the very people he wishes to protect, no thanks to the shapeshifting monsters he faces now.

When last we left our hero, he had wrecked a Dire Wraith funeral, slaying all he could in order to find his greatest weapon, the Neutralizer! However, they summoned the monstrous Deathwing, which knocked ROM into the depths of an unknown cave system. But our hero may not be alone...

Issues 1-8 can be found >>9335021 or http://www.mediafire.com/?1ivvjpjjvcl7o

I'll be putting up the next eight issues now.

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO JUN2_C999.jpg, 303 kB, 1600x1146
Anonymous Mon Jul 08 2013 11:21:45 No.9322441 ViewReport	
You guys should check out Fantast World Jun:

Vol 1 -
http://www.mediafire.com/download/ypt8gadl0vzg3nr/Fantasy_World_Jun_volume_1.rar

Vol 2
http://www.mediafire.com/download/9z8q2064hzq3x9y/Fantasy_World_Jun_Volume_2.rar

This is a beautiful manga, some of the most amazing art Shotaro Ishinomori has ever done. It's a manga really about storytelling, about loss, about life and about the world as a whole, one I'm told he did when coping with the loss of his sister. Hence the theme of sorrow and how it's part of life.
Anonymous Mon Jul 08 2013 10:50:33 No.9322334 ViewReport	
Robot Keiji ch. 7 released

http://www.mediafire.com/download/rj2ren9raeuucam/robot_Keiji_v01c07.rar	
Anonymous Mon Jul 08 2013 09:21:48 No.9322116 ViewReport	
Lemon People scans
http://www.mediafire.com/folder/j43cxesr4q45p/Lemon_People_scans	
View SameGoogleiqdbSauceNAO robottokeiji.jpg, 25 kB, 420x366
Anonymous Mon Jul 08 2013 00:51:32 No.9321212 ViewReport	
Robot Keiji Ch. 7 and Fantasy World Jun Vol. 2(END)

Keiji:
http://www.mediafire.com/download/rj2ren9raeuucam/robot_Keiji_v01c07.rar

Jun Vol.2
http://www.mediafire.com/download/9z8q2064hzq3x9y/Fantasy_World_Jun_Volume_2.rar

What an honor it was to work on this with our friend Guren. It's one of the most poignant, beautiful manga I've ever had the honor of working on. Jun's journey continues, taking him to beautiful new worlds, through amazing experiences and a quest to uncover the meaning of art, life, loss and sorrow.

This has my vote as THE manga of Shotaro Ishinomori with the exception of The Way Of Ryu. It's worth the price of admission just to see the art.

Enjoy, everyone.

When you read this, I just want everyone to keep in mind the tragedies Shotaro Ishinomori suffered, and the sheer work he put into this. The man was rightly known as the King of manga and he gave us an incredible archive to enjoy. It's a tragedy he's no longer with us, but nobody can live forever. I think Jun represents the man's work better than almost anything else he has done. As a scanlator, I love bringing his works out in English to people who would never enjoy them, and I find myself fascinated reading his thoughts and seeing his brilliance on the panels.

He wrote so many great stories and created characters that live on even after him. Robot Detective Keiji. Ryu. Kikaider. The 9 Cyborgs. Ichi the blind swordsman....while Tezuka was fond of writing himself into his own stories, to my knowledge, Jun is Shotaro's only avatar. Here we get to see his inner thoughts and the sheer beauty of his art, especially the color pages at the end.

In the end, I want to say that the world is better because of Shotaro Ishinomori's devotion to his art and he left us a great deal to enjoy. Thank you, Sensei. Long live the King.

For the previous releases, check here:

http://www.mediafire.com/happyscans
