Anonymous Mon Jul 01 2013 16:40:11 No.9291496 ViewReport	
>>9291478

First draft of the script was leaked a while ago. A lot of the elements are retained - Mako having a dead co-pilot, the Kaiju names, Hunnam's general character and other things - but there are some major differences. For one, there's only two named Jaegers in the film by the time the main story begins, Gypsy Danger and Tacit Ronin. Eureka, Alpha and Typhoon don't even exist, and Coyote Tango was formerly piloted by Raleigh and his brother instead of Danger. Pentecost also doesn't pilot, and there are a few other characters like a friend of Newt's and a crazy Russian scientist who didn't make it into the final cut.


Link is here.


http://www.mediafire.com/?lb8catctlrqriem

Oppai-Missile Sun Jun 30 2013 17:47:58 No.9288114 ViewReport	
mediafire.com/download/a29bow1193f54dd/Stage_11_eng.7z

Here's stage 11 (female/real). It's nice to translate something new again. I haven't had time to test these textures in the game myself, but they should work just the same as all the others.

By the way. Bring always gives me the base text files so I can just fill in the translation, and most of them work fine, but there's always some that give me this "Number of lines is not multiple of 10" error when I try to open them in the Dialogue Editor. This time it happened to a lot of them. It's not an issue since I can easily generate the files myself with the Texture Organizer, but it would be nice to know why this happens. Also, there was one scene that didn't include the text file and I couldn't generate it because some of the textures were messed up (I guess something happened while dumping?), so I had to input the filenames manually. It was a short scene of only like 3 or 4 lines though, so it wasn't a big deal.

Nozaku Wed Jun 26 2013 02:01:37 No.9270241 ViewReport	
I have more goodies for you /m/.

Mobile Suit Gundam Sidestory: A Place Beyond the Blaze Vol. 2. (Aka Gundam Thoroughbred). Thanks to S-rank for the scans and blanking the volume.

http://www mediafire com/download/shwfcrva4cyw0fw/Gundam_Thoroughbred-From_a_Place_Beyond_the_Blaze-_Vol_2.rar

(As is the norm, fill in the dots.)
I don't know why I didn't include them them in the first volume but I threw in the mechanical files (untranslated, shoot me, I was lazy) for vol 1 and 2 in this volume.

One final 3rd volume to go. the last one is a "what if" volume. But before that, since I like to alternate between series, I'll put out Mobile Suit Developers next.

One more housekeeping issue I'd like to bring up. If all goes well, I'll be in Japan for a year starting this October. I still want to continue translating stuff but you /m/en already know about Japan's strict downloading/uploading laws. I will not dare upload or download anything while I'm there and this complicates things, as i can't upload finished work and can't download new scans. Therefore, I was wondering if there are any willing souls out there that I can send text files to for text-shopping.
(I think s-rank is already onboard?)
We can figure out small details later.

Also, if there is no good way for me to get new scans to work on besides downloading, the next best thing to do is to just have them with me if/when I go. So if you /m/en have any requests, now (within these next 3 months) would be the time to get me these scans so I have something to do for the year there.

The darkness of AD Police Files illuminates how much Genom actually did improve social conditions in MegaTokyo between 2027 and 2032. The BGC: Before & After RPG sourcebook has a lot of discussion about changes in the society of BGC's setting:

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO ishinomorijun.jpg, 82 kB, 500x382
Anonymous Mon Jun 17 2013 13:20:55 No.9238799 ViewReport	
Happy Scans released Ishinomori's Fantasy World Jun some days ago. Here's the link:

http://www.mediafire.com/download/ypt8gadl0vzg3nr/Fantasy_World_Jun_volume_1.rar

Holy shit this was absolutely incredible. It's about an aspiring mangaka and his wild imagination. It doesn't have much of a story or even text, it's mostly just brilliant imaginative artwork flowing together in an abstract dreamlike way.

It's a manga really about storytelling, about loss, about life and about the world as a whole, one I'm told he did when coping with the loss of his sister. Hence the theme of sorrow and how it's part of life.

And here is an amusing bit of relevant 60's mangaka drama that I stole from the comments of the Happy Scans website:

"Actually, Jun won the Shogakukan Manga Award, Tezuka got jealous because it was competing with his life work, Hi no Tori, published on the same magazine. Being asked by a fan, he said that Jun was not a great example of the art of manga.

Apparently, Ishinomori was so offended by this statement that he almost canceled Jun at the time. But after that, Tezuka personally asked forgiveness to Ishinomori and as good admirer and follower of the great master, he accepted the apology and continued to publish the work.

Tezuka was very competitive and envious of the talent of others, and clearly Ishinomori was proving to have it in abundance. He also attacked Shigeru Mizuki saying that he has not drawing skills and the fact that he lost his left arm (Mizuki was left-handed) has nothing to do with it since there's nothing that the human body cannot accomplish with willpower. He also said that he could do better horror stories any time he wants.

Yeah, Tezuka was hardly the Mr. Nice Guy he's usually portrayed as."

View SameGoogleiqdbSauceNAO SRWGC.jpg, 172 kB, 850x580
Super Robot Wars GC Translation thread #6
Steve Sun Jun 09 2013 12:16:16 No.9213510 ViewReport	
I guess it's time for me to kick one of these off, since I've yet to start one.


Shamelessly copied from the old topic:

Folder containing all the stuff we've done: mediafire.com/srwgc

Big pdf explaining the whole translation process in detail: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rzlnrnogfzw7kk6/SRW%20GC%20Translation%20Toolkit%20Tutorial.zip

Quick guide on how to use: download Dolphin emulator version 3.0 (it must be this version) and install. In the graphics settings, set texture cache all the way to "safe" and enable "load custom textures". Download the translated stuff from the Mediafire folder above and put the textures in Dolhpin's main folder\User\Load\Textures\GRWJD9\ (create this folder if it doesn't exist). You don't need to worry about the text files if you're just an end user.

The tools used in this translation (along with the big pdf) can be found here:

http://www.romhacking.net/utilities/940/

General progress? The dialogue's been translated up to mission 10, menus are finished up to mission 9, and battle lines are up to 8, I think. Last I heard, the male MC translations were done up to mission 2. We'll probably release a complete pack for everything that's finished once everyone's caught up to mission 10 (That was the original plan, right?).

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO GRWJD9-57.png, 327 kB, 640x480
Dashman Mon Jun 03 2013 21:13:08 No.9192714 ViewReport	
>>9192578
>How does this work
Please read the first post.

>what are you supposed to download
If you just want the translated lines, get the translated textures packs from the mediafire folder and the (few) ones that have been released in this thread (use the search function of your browser to find "dropbox" and "medifire") and the fixes.

>do the new downloads have the fixes already applied
If you're asking if the packs for stage 06 and 07 have weird jumps, I can't tell you for sure. I've been extra careful with those (and even modified the tools to automatically avoid the problem in a lot of cases -but not all) and they should be mostly ok...

BUT, there's a problem with ALL battle dialogues that have more than 1 line. The carriage return counts as an extra texture, and has a different hash than the texture with the full line(s) even though it has the exact same content. There's no way of telling which one of those should go first and second, so the only way of telling if the line is fine is by seeing it happen translated in-game... which in most cases is a RANDOM thing.

tl;dr; There's going to be more fixes in the future. Period.

Chromestrike Mon Jun 03 2013 02:40:29 No.9189494 ViewReport	
DO YOU LIKE MECHS? IS THERE SOMETHING SEXY ABOUT MASSIVE BIPEDAL MACHINES RIPPING EACHOTHER APART? DO YOU ENJOY YOUR MACHINE BEING ONE-SHOT BY AIRCRAFT LAUNCHED MUNITIONS? YOU BET YOUR DAMN ASS YOU DO. READ ON.

Yep, it's about that time. About a year and a half ago I unveiled rules-light mech RPG for /tg/, seeing as how there wasn't a easy, real-robot system out there. It's been met with favorable responses over the months. Today I present to you 0.9.84, which has a huge heap of new content. There's a few placeholder texts left over, and there might be a typo here and there, but it's solid enough to present. Of particular note is the new Prime, Beico, which offers all sorts of fun, like efficient-minded parts and missile goodness.

New Beico parts added, the setting has been heavily updated, aircraft and country-specific mechs have been created, etc. The WARGAME portion of ChromeStrike (Yes, you can run the game as a wargame, with like twenty plus vehicles to a side) is also being worked on. This edition gets a call-out to Bludhawk, who has been hugely responsible for the updated fluff and new mechs, plus backgrounds.

There's a lot to talk about this edition, but it'd be great to get general feedback and queries. Let us know your thoughts.

New Rulebook:
http://www.mediafire.com/?qu7jy24y2mim4sp

-Duke's intro.
For additional reading, some rules made up by a GM; http://www.mediafire.com/?5lz4qkr35ffnatq

>>9164615
it's goofy subs for Mazinger Z (or other shows) from pirate DVDs that take the japanese dialog, translate it to chinese, then to English.

They're usually less insane in the context of the show. Like "increase the soup" is followed by a knob or a dial or a beam increasing. They're more enjoyable in the show.
http://anime.thehylia.com/downloads/series/devilman is for Devilman, they also had Mazinger last time I checked.
http://www.mediafire.com/folder/p0nvc3kqbnlrq/demon_god_z_crabstick_softsubs are some encodes I made from my HK set

>>9159158
The "chanchachaan" is actually in the line too. Changing it for "ta-dah!" is possible, but it not only is a bit too short in comparison, but also feels kind of weird to read it like that when it's so clearly spoken... just my opinion, though.

The other part is a little play on the "Elvis has left / entered the building". Using "arrived on the scene" would actually be closer to the original, but I think the comedy effect is lost there.

Dashman Thu May 16 2013 16:27:40 No.9121633 ViewReport	
>>9119988
You'll have to be patient, we're still editing the first 10 scenarios. And our main editor happens to be the main dialogue dumper... and the one managing the mediafire folder... and is *very* busy with his job as well.

On other news, I "solved" the problem of the text jumping back and forth in the middle of battle dialogues. Turns out I was wrong and it wasn't a case of files having the same size, but files having the *wrong* size.

To understand what I mean, you can check the files in this zip, compare them and wonder why one is bigger than the other (I honestly have no idea):

https://www.dropbox.com/s/6sq8y2ybdd74738/wtf%20sizes.zip

Now the Texture Organizer and the Battle Dialogue Editor make a second pass when ordering them and avoid the problem. In case anybody wants the new versions, you can grab them from here:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/mjd6ekmqd69nc79/SRW_GC_Texture_Organizer_v1.2e.zip

https://www.dropbox.com/s/8flhcs2w52ius9m/SRW_GC_Battle_Editor_v1.2f.zip

I couldn't implement the bitwise comparisons between images, but this fix won't mean a noticeable slowdown so I guess it's ok.

I'll keep my eyes open to find the lines that were broken before, but if you find any feel free to say it.

>>85486350

After a grueling amount of work, the second partial patch for MLAF is here. This patch covers the Birthday, Onsen, and Christmas arcs, as well as the introductory portion of the Beach arc. This covers approximately 65% of the game.

You may be thrilled to note that the translation no longer requires the use of AralTrans, and hopefully that will relieve some of the headaches everyone's been having.

Enjoy!

http://www.mediafire.com/?19br178bxhhix62

Backland Stride: An Armored Core/Zone of the Enders/Star Trek inspired Game
Anonymous Fri May 03 2013 20:56:46 No.9068867 ViewReport	
After a few months of development and playtesting, the first version of Backland Stride is here!
http://www.mediafire.com/?2zd4pb326zglx16

Okay, maybe I'm getting ahead of myself here. Backland Stride is a Roleplaying Game co-developed by me and a friend, designed specifically for roleplaying mercenaries inspired by Armored Core's Ravens who pilot one of a kind high powered machines, known here as Runners and Stride Armors respectively.

Oh yeah, and it's mecha creation/customization is pretty detailed yet simple to get the hang of. And the entire thing has the air of a soft science fiction TV Show like Star Trek, including Green Skinned space chicks and Ctarl-Ctarl.

There's an IRC channel for the game too, #BacklandStride on irc.rizon.net

Shhh... let them sleep.

Well, some things were uploaded shortly before the demise of the last thread and some people may have missed them. I'll post the links here:

- Steve's 3rd batch of menu pack, which makes pretty much everything up to stage 7 look nicer:

http://www.mediafire.com/?ot7qd1lv8qv3r2m

- Male / Super dialogues from stages 1 - 2b, dumped and sorted by Guy G. and translated by Oppai:

Stage 01 male/super lines: mediafire.com/?zvgspg8ehk8vv1n

Stage 02 male/super lines: mediafire.com/?bakc9hhsi4fzo5c

Stage 02b male/super lines: mediafire.com/?n8anpa3aeau3s61

There's also pastebin links and mediafire links to sorted but untranslated files, which I won't post as I think Oppai and Guy have access to them and I don't think they will be of use to anybody else.

- Translated intro as seen in OP's picture (still needs some work, graphics editors are welcome on this):

https://www.dropbox.com/s/02m7xb6zdnzzdce/edited%20intro.7z

Bring, if you have the time, please upload these to the mediafire folder... Or maybe it is possible for somebody else to do it? I don't have a mediafire account so I don't know how it works, and I feel bad about troubling you with this...


- Finally, the tools used in this translation (along with the big pdf) can be found here:

http://www.romhacking.net/utilities/940/

Should you want to:

a) help
b) translate the game to another language
c) insert joke translations (like the Milky Tits saga or the MSG Abridged dialogues)

then grab the toolkit, read the pdf and do what you may.

View SameGoogleiqdbSauceNAO GRWJD9-58.jpg, 209 kB, 640x480
Super Robot Wars GC Translation thread #5
Oppai-Missile Wed May 01 2013 23:49:38 No.9061158 ViewReport	
Continuing our translation effort.

Current progress: event dialogue for female protagonist/real robot up to stage 10.5, male protagonist/super robot up to stage 02.5, a whole lot of menu stuff, title screen, a bunch of battle dialogue. Stuff undergoing QC, we'll have a partial batch out once that's done.

Folder containing all the stuff we've done: mediafire.com/srwgc

Big pdf explaining the whole translation process in detail: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rzlnrnogfzw7kk6/SRW%20GC%20Translation%20Toolkit%20Tutorial.zip

Quick guide on how to use: download Dolphin emulator version 3.0 (it must be this version) and install. In the graphics settings, set texture cache all the way to "safe" and enable "load custom textures". Download the translated stuff from the Mediafire folder above and put the textures in Dolhpin's main folder\User\Load\Textures\GRWJD9\ (create this folder if it doesn't exist). You don't need to worry about the text files if you're just an end user.

Feedback is appreciated.
View SameGoogleiqdbSauceNAO GRWJD9-58.jpg, 209 kB, 640x480
Oppai-Missile Wed May 01 2013 23:44:29 No.9061133 ViewReport	
Continuing our translation effort.

Current progress: event dialogue for female protagonist/real robot up to stage 10.5, male protagonist/super robot up to stage 02.5, a whole lot of menu stuff, title screen, a bunch of battle dialogue. Stuff undergoing QC, we'll have a partial batch out once that's done.

Folder containing all the stuff we've done: mediafire.com/srwgc

Big pdf explaining the whole translation process in detail: https://www.dropbox.com/s/rzlnrnogfzw7kk6/SRW%20GC%20Translation%20Toolkit%20Tutorial.zip

Quick guide on how to use: download Dolphin emulator version 3.0 (it must be this version) and install. In the graphics settings, set texture cache all the way to "safe" and enable "load custom textures". Download the translated stuff from the Mediafire folder above and put the textures in Dolhpin's main folder\User\Load\Textures\GRWJD9\ (create this folder if it doesn't exist). You don't need to worry about the text files if you're just an end user.

Feedback is appreciated.

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO chromestrike0.982.jpg, 91 kB, 445x353
Chromestrike
NotDuke Mon Apr 22 2013 01:03:07 No.9018145 ViewReport	
DO BIPEDAL GUN PLATFORMS STRIKE A CHORD WITHIN YOUR SOUL? DO YOU LIKE MECHS? DO YOU ALSO LIKE RASHES AND JUNGLE FEVER? DO YOU LIKE YOUR MECH BREAKING DOWN AND YOUR CHARACTER DYING OF MALARIA AND DEHYDRATION? Actually you probably don't. That's okay.

ChromeStrike time. About a year and a half ago I unveiled a rules-light mech RPG for you folks, seeing as how there wasn't a easy, real-robot system out there. It's been met with favorable responses over the months, and contributions and brainstormings from /tg/ have helped shape it into something pretty nifty. Just this week my idea-guys have bashed heads together to come up with a South American prime corp; Emerald Gardens. This release mostly contains their background and various parts, plus a few additional weapon types.

Today I present 0.9.82, which was actually mostly done by other folks then myself. Let's have a moment of thankful silence for my people, and then move on to the EG mechs- the all-terrain, semi-amphibious machines that actually survive and thrive in jungle environments. I've also got some ideas under wraps for the Opposing Forces expansion, and may or may not do a Space Opera expansion some time in the future also.

Goal this thread is general feedback and observations, complaints, the normal. Gimme.

New Rulebook:
http://www.mediafire.com/?xva6av1qpq9y6dz

-Duke's intro. Questions?

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO robotkeiji.png, 437 kB, 500x420
Anonymous Sun Apr 14 2013 12:12:44 No.8986229 ViewReport	
Robot Keiji is back and we wrap up the Stork murder story. Thanks to Sonickrazy as always for translating this Ishinmori classic, so in appreciation you should go check out his blog here. In this chapter we see K, using some his many gadgets to solve this chilling case and we even get some forshadowing to an enemy K will face in the coming chapters. Even after is all said and done the chapter ends bitter sweet for everyone in the story, Ishinmori showing that even when the case is closed, things don't go back magically to what they were before. Some may think that just because this is a series about a robot who solves crimes that it would be cheesy and just silly. Really its more then that, it plays out like a real detecitve story just with a robot as a main character. Ishinmoris hero's come off as silly and over the top but beyond the seemly silly concepts they are characters that are endearing showen by how people still read them to this day and what makes Ishinmori one of historys best. Also I love how even with all the future stuff in the series like K and his flying car the world still acts like it should.

Chapter 4 - http://www.mediafire.com/?gtrsiukajhsizxl

Visit the Happy Scans website for more.
Anonymous Sun Apr 14 2013 11:38:52 No.8986067 ViewReport

Super Robot Wars GC Translation Thread #4
Bring Stabity Tue Apr 09 2013 12:38:17 No.8965588 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>8966069
Link to previous thread
>>8907916

In case you didn't notice, this game is getting translated. Not only it's being translated, it's being "soft-subbed" using Dolphin (Gamecube/Wii emulator) and you can check the progress of the translation as we release chapters!

Wanna try it? Do the following:

1. Download Dolphin 3.0 from this page. It's the last entry. Note, other versions will not work. Do not get 3.5
http://www.dolphin-emulator.com/download.html

2. Download the stage dialogues (1-2b are in a batch, nothing else has been included in a batch yet) and menu translation from here.
https://www.mediafire.com/srwgc#8hoepp2pmlr88

3. Put the translated textures in User\Load\Textures\GRWJD9\ inside of the Dolphin folder.

4. Set Texture caching to safe.

5. Turn on load custom textures.

6. Enjoy. Tell us about any problems that you find, be sure to include a save state or detailed instructions on how to recreate the problem.

*NOTE: The translation does NOT work in a real Gamecube.
*NOTE 2: There are some joke translations like pic related and MSG:A the actual translation is genuine.
Anonymous Tue Apr 09 2013 10:15:23 No.8965266 ViewReport

Dashman Sat Mar 30 2013 00:21:53 No.8925749 ViewReport	
Well, I'm not a good translator, but I was trying the texture organizer for battle dialogues and the battle editor and came up with some translations for battles in stage 3:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/aykbvkfuymo7eeh/Translated%20Battle%20Dialogues%2001.rar

This translates most lines of Zeon/Giganos soldiers, a bunch of lines of the Dragonar boys, lots Amuro's lines, almost anything that Gene says and a couple of things from Denim, Akimi, Fairey and the J9. Unzip it in the load folder and you'll have some non-accurate translations with a couple of display errors here and there for those guys.

The untranslated textures and the battle dialogue files are here:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/3qlir1c2t8f5vz9/Battle%20Dialogues%20Stage%203%20%28untranslated%29.rar

for whenever a translator can pick them up and correct what I did.

Also, I dumped some of those messages that happen when you save and suspend the game:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/uva98884vnev4vh/Suspend%20Game.rar

Bring, could you add these files to the mediafire folder? That way we won't have a bunch of links later.

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO translation thread logo.png, 454 kB, 717x371
SUPER ROBOT TAISEN GC TRANSLATION THREAD #3
Dashman Sun Mar 24 2013 21:55:22 No.8907916 ViewReport	
In case you didn't notice, this game is getting translated. Not only it's being translated, it's being "soft-subbed" using Dolphin (Gamecube/Wii emulator) and you can check the progress of the translation as we release chapters!

Wanna try it? Do the following:

1. Download Dolphin 3.0 from this page. It's the last entry. Note, other versions will not work. Do not get 3.5
http://www.dolphin-emulator.com/download.html

2. Download the stage dialogues (1-2b are in a batch, 3 hasn't been included in a batch yet) and menu translation from here.
https://www.mediafire.com/srwgc#8hoepp2pmlr88
http://www.mediafire.com/?l2h1h5m0hlgem9a - Stage 3

3. Put the translated textures in User\Load\Textures\GRWJD9\ inside of the Dolphin folder.

4. Set Texture caching to safe.

5. Set External Frame Buffer to Virtual (Not sure if necessary)

6. Turn on load custom textures.

7. Enjoy. Tell us about any problems that you find, be sure to include a save state or detailed instructions on how to recreate the problem.

*NOTE: The translation does NOT work in a real Gamecube.
GoogleiqdbSauceNAO 10044.png, 31 kB, 320x199
Anonymous Sun Mar 24 2013 20:29:44 No.8907541 ViewReport	
>>8907528
exe
in terms of tools from what i tested simply searching for basic resource editor can be enough

http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?9b98sxfsxnhdhh7	
Bring Stabity Sun Mar 24 2013 19:35:35 No.8907359 ViewReport	
>>8907339
May as well write a guide that can be posted in the next thread as well.

1. Download Dolphin 3.0 from this page. It's the last entry. Note, other versions will not work. Do not get 3.5
http://www.dolphin-emulator.com/download.html

2. Download the stage dialogues (1-2b are in a batch, 3 hasn't been included in a batch yet) and menu translation from here.
https://www.mediafire.com/srwgc#8hoepp2pmlr88

3. Put the translated textures in User\Load\Textures\GRWJD9\ inside of the Dolphin folder.

4. Enjoy, and be on the lookout for untranslated lines. Battle dialogue is not translated, so don't bother mentioning that.

I thought at the beginning that I could use some kind of log with the filenames that had been "moved" already (showing it on the lists somehow) and saving it to a file, but that would become huge after some time. Even if I used a Dictionary class for fast checking the names while in the applet, wouldn't the initial read of the log take a long time when the dumped files start to reach 5 - 6 digits?

Don't worry about it. Except for this time, I always turn off dump textures before going back to rewatch the scene. It's just that I forgot this time. It will indubitably happen again, but I figure it'll be a rare event. Don't worry about fixing this particular case of user error.

>>8902169
Has anyone been having issues with attack names not being translated? I saw them in the folder, but they're not showing up for me in game.

>>8902931

http://www.mediafire.com/?4iq5ye9yf3hb08t	
Oppai-Missile Sat Mar 23 2013 13:41:33 No.8902931 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>8903272
Okay, I figured I'd put all the stuff I've done in a single file to make it easier for people try it if they want to.

mediafire.com/?lnbg0ofltvxl27f

These are the complete translated dialogue textures for stages 01, 02 and 02b. It has some of the corrections people suggested so far, though I didn't exactly go through the whole thing again. It's also now sorted in sobfulders by stage.

Just put the "Dialogues" folder inside Dolphin's User\Load\Textures\GRWJD9 folder, with the Dolphin version and settings as explained by Bring in >>8902015, and choose the female protagonist and real robot. Also get the menu textures made by Steve here >>8902169, and you'll be able to play the first three stages almost completely in English. One big thing that's still missing is the scrolling intro, I've included the translation for it in a .txt file, but the textures still need to be done by hand.
Dashman Sat Mar 23 2013 10:41:17 No.8902406 ViewReport	
>>8902347
ah, I just checked Magenta's guide and it seems there are indeed no split routes. The only thing affecting dialogues would be your choice between Super and Real as well as Male and Female. Since you started playing because of this translation, I assume you took the girl and the real robot, right?

Anyway, when I say "upload your save" I just mean your memory card file. It should be in User/GC most probably named as MemoryCardA.JAP.raw.

If you only have one saved game inside the memory card, it would be very helpful if you could start saving one file per stage from now on. When you fill the memory card of saved games, you upload it somewhere (like mediafire) so that somebody can use it to access those stages.

On a different note. I just fixed the bug with getting weird relatives in event dialogues. I check for the alpha of the pixels now, instead of checking if the pixel has a value different than 0. I'll try improving the load of the dump folder now.
Steve Sat Mar 23 2013 08:32:24 No.8902169 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>8902931 >>8903272
Okay, here we go.

http://www.mediafire.com/?w17m6lf2ld7p2lv

This is the first release of the translated menu textures I've been working on. I wanted to finish up some more stuff before doing the first release, but I can always update it as I go.

Take the SRTGC Texture folder, place it in Dolphin's User\Load\Textures\GRWJD9 directory, and...you're done, basically.

>>8902015 has listed the settings you'll need. I don't see any reason this thing wouldn't work, but I'd like some confirmation that it does. I didn't have a chance to change everything over to the Safe-compatible textures, so I'm still working on that.

This is still a work in progress, and nowhere near being complete, but hopefully this will help people play it.
Bring Stabity Sat Mar 23 2013 04:45:41 No.8902015 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>8902169 >>8902931
>>8902002
Make sure you have Dolphin 3.0 (no rev). This will NOT work with any other version. Make sure you use D3D9, not 11, not GL, not software, 9. Under Graphics>Hacks, turn texture caching to safe (very left of the slider) and enable virtual external frame buffer. After that, set internal resolution, fullscreen resolution, anti-aliasing, and anisotropic filter to whatever settings your computer can handle. Lastly turn on load custom textures.

Set up the controller however you'd like.

Then, download the three texture packs that Oppai has released so far.
http://www.mediafire.com/srwgc#8hoepp2pmlr88

Put them in DolphinFolder\User\Load\Textures\GRWJD9\

Start up the game and check if all the dialogue is translated.
Bring Stabity Sat Mar 23 2013 04:25:27 No.8901992 ViewReport	
>>8901584
I got another funny for you. I left "Dump Textures" on while I was going though the outro the second time so I can match the dumped text to the dialogue (I don't really need it, but I feel safer that way. What was basically happening, was that I used your tool to move the files over to my sorted folder, and as soon as Dolphin saw that that texture wasn't dumped, it redumped it. Since the textures are sorted by dump date, I didn't even notice that this was going on until I finished the outro, reached the intermission menu, and saw that I still had the same fuckhuge list of unsorted (white) textures as when I started.

And speaking of the end of Stage 03.

Some dude, I guess called Squall, did subs through episode 36. I don't know if he ripped them off of something like CR or if this is an old translation from somewhere else but I don't think they are the same translation as Live-Evil's episodes. I haven't compared them against the video or checked if they are well timed or not so that would probably be a good idea for anyone to do.

Some guys I never heard of called R-Z productions did 37-60, but 37-48 are all 2 episode per script which, though it should be easy enough to split the script and time shift the second half to where it should be, almost always means that the script gets progressively more out-of-sync as the video goes on because they (I don't know why but this is my theory) are probably ripped off or timed to a DVD or something and lacking a time ramp but fuck if I know since I am limited in such knowledge. After 48 the files through 60 are just .txt transcripts from RZ and should probably just be ignored.

>>8888103
I last released up to the mission objectives. Did you see dash's v1.2 tool? It automatically grabs filenames from a folder.

This has all the in-mission event dialogue (except for once you kill all enemies).
http://www.mediafire.com/?uyt7xhu4sxc5psc

Dash. Tool idea. Battle dialogue. Low priority.
Folder structure:

Dialogue name
| -- 1
| .. + -- file
| -- 2
| .. + -- file
| -- 3
| .. + -- file
etc.

Battle dialogue with special character for breaks.
eg. Raijin-Oh! -> Ra^i^ji^n-^O^h^!

Will generate 8 textures:
<blank except for pilot name>
Ra
Rai
Raiji
Raijin-
Raijin-O
Raijin-Oh
Raijin-Oh!

Like I said, low priority, event dialogue is more important.

Oppai-Missile Mon Mar 18 2013 00:59:48 No.8885221 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>8885413
mediafire.com/?bmj636h3w45lzzd

Here it is, translations of everything from >>8884518. That's the shady people conversation, the big scrolling intro, the flashback scene and the first scene at the office. Just dump all the textures in the User\Load\Textures\GRWJD9 folder and it should work, though make sure you're using Dolphin 3.0 with texture cache accuracy at SAFE. Choose female protagonist, real robot (not sure this matters though) and leave all names at default.

I didn't do the textures for the scrolling intro though, since that would have taken too long on top of doing the translation, but I did include a .txt with the translation for it and another few textures that need to be done by hand. It would be real nice if someone volunteers to do those.

Astrapentagona Sun Mar 10 2013 17:59:58 No.8857770 ViewReport	
http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?7m0nkswhksgrd1g

In case I die or for anyone's peace of mind. There are probably some other refinements that could be done but I am waiting for the actual BD rips to sync the OP/ED lyrics to the hardsubbed kana and do the styles. I plan on doing that and the time-shifting myself.

I made some changes to the grammar where I just couldn't ignore it but I tried to avoid it as much as possible since that wasn't my goal. I also may have missed some stuff in my sleepless nights or you may not agree to various other things in punctuation/capitalization. If anyone wants to spruce it up in that regard or do some TL checks I will give you a free blowjob. There were places I found the translation questionable but I don't know Japanese, I think the only time I changed a line based on that was when Deck said "atarimae desho" and the sub said something like "The enemy's in front!" which I think is too wrong to be translation error and most likely some kind of misplaced line or something.

When I say "near-perfect" copies of the times, some lines are delayed from the Shin-Getter sub by a few hundredths of a second but I do not think it should matter since they had lead-in anyway. If you are just some kind of obsessive time freak Shin-Getter purist and care about it so much you will go through it again, I will give you a free blowjob as well.

But I doubt anyone will be getting a free blowjob.

View SameGoogleiqdbSauceNAO 8815171.jpg, 218 kB, 600x800
M.D. Geist - 2013 Edit DDL
Vendaval Este Fri Mar 08 2013 17:30:25 No.8850661 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>8850823
I recently came out with this:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qoEGiHA3m94

A "fix" of the original cut of M.D. Geist that uses DVD and Laserdisc footage of both the 1986 and 1996 versions to make a complete version free of nearly all of the initial animation errors, re-purposed 1996 animation, some new audio to make some reworked scenes transition better along with some printed source material being referenced to expand the prologue slightly. I did this because the original voice cast version seems to be the most well-liked and considering it's never been properly "restored" I felt I may as well have done it while making use of the other material that was inadvertently spawned through M.D. Geist being released in the US.

What I now have is a DDL .avi with a soft sub file for those who may have wanted this thing on their computer, this download's subs have also been timed a little better, re-written slightly and as well as that some other things have been tidied up so the presentation is now much cleaner and neater. This should hopefully be a considered option for people looking to watch this OVA for the first time as well.

http://www.mediafire.com/?cctpvtckvjq6wjs
Enjoy.

>>8816947
Re-uploading to MediaFire is ultimately a passive task, you just drop files there and wait them to upload. Sadpanda requires you to select every file individually you want to upload, which would mean actually me sitting here and actively clicking though 9 610 files for Muv-Luv Extra/Unlimited alone. Still, if they have streamlined the upload process, then I might consider it.

Just for Trivia, Win7 MLA has 26 220 separate CG images.

Anonymous Thu Feb 21 2013 08:37:09 No.8799161 ViewReport	
Hey op, here's what I can help you with:
These are the past scrubs from episode 17 to 33:

http://www.mediafire.com/555scrubs

These were all the episodes done by JettoSubs, they also did the movie DC version but the subs were lost (if somebody has it please re-upload!)

you can also find this helpful:

http://japasubs.com/serie.php?c=rider&s=kr_555

That site has english subs (looks like tvn rips) for eps 7 - 14 and the movie. You will also find the portuguese subs' timing useful if you use it as a template for your works.

As stated before, TVN has fixed most of the translation mistakes up to episode 28 for their v2 releases. The problem really starts with everything after that.

View SameGoogleiqdbSauceNAO giant robot.jpg, 634 kB, 1600x1027
Anonymous Sun Feb 10 2013 13:13:07 No.8761230 ViewReport	
The great men of Happy Scans just released the Giant Robo manga.

Some of you may remember the epic, stellar Giant Robo OVA series, directed by the great Yasuhiro Imagawa. Truly a masterpiece. Here, however, we present you the original manga it was based on, another Sci Fi classic by our man, Mitsuteru Yokoyama. A more...uplifting story than Mars, to be certain. Featuring the heroes controlling Giant Robo against the world-domination plotting group Big Fire.

Thanks to our friends at Dynamic Pro for scanning this beast and Chaos for his epic translation work. And a big thanks to our man Ani_ for his great typesetting, and Kazu for his QC job. Hope to have volume 2 out before long!

http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?ydjbci74ere33bc

Also, check their Henshin Ninja Arashi manga release. That one is awesome and should be read by everyone:

Vol. 1 - http://www.mediafire.com/?3dv373ge9jpn9r4

Vol. 2 - http://www.mediafire.com/?npl7gl9kbn54uct	
GoogleiqdbSauceNAO prevm.jpg, 379 kB, 806x742
Anaheim Girl's Love Story translation released
Anonymous Sun Feb 10 2013 00:54:16 No.8759839 ViewReport	
Alright /m/, it's late here and I'm tired, so I'll make this short. I finished the translation to Anaheim Girl's Love Story, that Gundam yuri Visual Novel, and this is the release thread. If you've ever wanted to see a bunch of lesbians building a Gundam, well, here's your chance. Download here: mediafire.com/?1yyki7exzlcmshx (that's just the translation, find the game for yourself.)

As I've said before, this is NOT a patch, it's an external translation to be read alongside the real thing. I think I managed to make it fairly simple to use, it works like you see in the picture, but do read the included instructions. Also, I double-checked the whole thing to the best of my ability and sanity, but it's entirely possible that I fucked something up, so report any problems and I'll fix them as soon as I can. It's a small download, so I can always replace whatever.
GoogleiqdbSauceNAO WCActionStationsCover.jpg, 120 kB, 500x822
Anonymous Sat Feb 09 2013 22:56:16 No.8759481 ViewReport	
>>8759455

As I said Action Stations is actually pretty damn good, though it takes a bit more of a 'Star Wars' approach to WC (there are a bunch of aliens species that either weren't in the game or were briefly mentioned just living around the galaxy and even on earth, there's a obligatory hive of scum and villainy, etc)
It's really about Tolwyn's early days as a cadet and is treated as a historical drama that tried to illuminate on why he ended up space-Hitler.
Also it shows Kilrathi who even OPPOSE the fucking war.

Here's all the novels:

http://www.mediafire.com/?ppx13zwxq7x3i3t

Anonymous Tue Feb 05 2013 01:02:40 No.8744204 ViewReport	
>>8744186
alternate retelling of the original series, no zeta nor ZZ. it's just called a trilogy because it was released as three books, the first called "awakening", the second called "escalation", the third called "confrontation"

it's not canon in any way, but it provides a bit of insight into some of the characters, at least the ones that didn't change much in depiction

it's quite a departure from the original series, amuro and crew are enlisted soldiers training to pilot the project V MS rather than "teenagers forced to pilot gundams", the entire story is set in space and does not go to earth, and other things happen, like the RX-78-2 being destroyed and amuro receiving the G3 as a replacement

the ending is quite different as well, it involves amuro being killed by a grunt pilot after he lets his guard down, and the white base teaming up with kycilia's newtype unit to go after and kill ghiren

here's the link to the same scans I have. I think someone on /m/ was converting this into an ebook format, but I don't know where to get it, or whether /rs/ lists it

http://www.mediafire.com/?0j4cq1drwaxc2qq

Searching for posts that contain ‘mediafire’.
GoogleiqdbSauceNAO gWaHY8x.jpg, 130 kB, 678x906
ThatKRAnon !!Y96zkWkbsSi Thu Jan 24 2013 15:59:23 No.8703138 ViewReport	
So /m/ have you guys seen the preview for this yet? Thoughts?

http://www.mediafire.com/?jgmmuob4t11o3cw
http://www.sendspace.com/file/1zbjkd
http://www.tusfiles.net/0g8zzi24v3yy
http://ryushare.com/geypq02spjwv/Cyborg_009_-_Chapter_000_(2013)_(93pgs-Digital-Nero).cbz

As far as art goes I've always been a fan of Marcus To, but seeing Cyborg 009 with American cape like art is a bit weird. I'd probably have preferred someone more cartoony, but if I have to accept it with cape art, Marcus To probably would have been a first choice anyway.

As far as designs go, in terms of looking at them as an American cape version of Cyborg 009 I do actually love them and I'm glad the scarfs will be coming into it at some point. Because of To's style the characters are pretty sleek and at most look toned, or well built for some, while none are bursting out of their clothes barely able to contain their muscles. Plus there was a clear effort to maintain a lot of the exaggerated facial featuers some characters had while doing it in a more realisitic style that I appreciate.

I know we'd seen some of these preview pages that showed the powers in action already, but I do actually like the visual depiction of the powers. I feel like the Iron Man style legs for 002 is a good way to approach his ability to fly being a cyborg.

In terms of actual story I'll need to see when it actually comes out in full but from the preview it feels too close to the original. Don't get me wrong if it wasn't holding true to the original I'd be pretty annoyed by it, but it feels so close I question the point of it. It lacks any real individuallity and so many moments feel like reading the original manga but just with Marcus To art. But we'll see when the full thing hits I guess.
GoogleiqdbSauceNAO 01_042.jpg, 481 kB, 968x1400
S-Rank Anon Wed Jan 23 2013 21:31:26 No.8701314 ViewReport

Doubt any more will get done by me.

Anonymous Tue Jan 22 2013 03:45:26 No.8696351 ViewReport	
Quoted By: >>8696552
I found this thread yesterday and became pretty interested. After reading docs I tried to hack 2G. First I modified character set a little, because game didn't have small letters (had to make them myself, so you can imagine how awful they are). Then I experimented with HEX editor, and now I have full table for my edited ROM, including punctuation marks and hiragana/katakana that wasn't used for making small letters. I could also translate the game, but I'm lazy fucktard and I seriously doubt I can ever complete it. Besides, as you can see, my English almost reaches crabstick level, so there's probably no need for such "translation".
I'm not sure if it's helpful at all, but if you need modified ROM and table for it (it's in Shift-JIS), you can download them here: http://www.mediafire.com/?v6sdplpa7a7b4df

Exaltedfag !ln4ZhLKk4c Tue Jan 15 2013 05:40:00 No.8678036 ViewReport	
Crossposted from /tg/.

Gentlemen.
After a great amount of rewrites and starting back from scratch because I'm never happy with anything I do EVER, I'd like to present /tg/ (and /m/) with the first alpha of a game I've been working on, Super Robot Wars OG Tabletop.

Just as the name says, it's meant to be a RPG set in the Super Robot Wars OG universe, with the characters as robot pilots. For now, all that's done is the core mechanics, character creation, and little more.

The game hasn't been playtested extensively, and is probably broken as hell. It doesn't have a contents index, and I'm aware that it's likely badly organized.

But I wanted to share this, hoping for some feedback. If you can spare the time to flip through this and contribute with criticism, ideas, suggestions or anything useful, I'd be thankful.

(I don't normally tripfag, but I'm taking up a tripcode for the purpose of this thread.)

The PDF can be found at: http://www.mediafire.com/?o89ljq8ljtinzj2

Only thing is, I have no idea how to get this thing hosted on something like TPB or bakabt; uploaded it to 2shared at least.

I'll seed this for the next fifteen hours or so, but I normally just keep torrents running during the night so I'm not sure how well this is gonna work to be honest. If someone has an alternative method to spending six hours individually uploading each video to a site though, I'm all ears.

Also be warned, these are not good quality videos; they're 55mb .wmv files, and sound like you'd expect from someone recording them with a VCR twenty-thirty years ago. They are, however, the only English dub of Daimos I know to exist, even if it is hilariously bad.

Anonymous Fri Nov 30 2012 17:30:25 No.8504590 ViewReport	
Figured I might as well repost this here: http://www.mediafire.com/?lb8catctlrqriem

It's an early draft of the script, and it mentions some robots we haven't seen yet (including more US ones and a couple of South American ones) and also gives us some more ideas about their capabilities. One very high tech robot, a newer model, round-house kicks a kaiju, though it almost blows out the shock absorbers in its legs in the process.

Gipsy Danger, the older, slightly out of date American model, has a plasma cannon, a chest laser, a shoulder-mounted Gatling cannon, a retractable magnetic chain that can stiffen into a sword, and hip-mounted missile launchers.

Anonymous Thu Nov 29 2012 18:16:22 No.8499753 ViewReport	
I asked this in /anime/ and in /a/, but in case those doesn't get any replies,

Can I run something by anyone who cares to listen?

As you can see above, I was trying to insert the existing translation of the TE demo into the game using NullPointer's plugin (the one currently used for the Before the Shimmering Time Ends translation).

However as mentioned above on close inspection there appears to have been some pretty liberal rewriting and embellishing, so I tried to reword it to be a bit closer to the original.

But my Japanese ability is definitely almost nonexistent (one only has to look at the timeline on the wiki to know that), and it's very slow going as it's almost a complete retranslation, and a poor one too.

So,
Here's what I've done so far
http://www.mediafire.com/view/?hrn7b5dcwn9rfvt

And here's his translation
http://www.mediafire.com/view/?k21q55zbbblyqwy

Is anyone able and willing to check it over and judge whether or not that guy's translation is good enough to just be stuck straight in, and if not whether someone else is willing to pick this up? Because I don't think I'll be able to do this anymore with deadlines and midsessional exams approaching, and with my level of 'Japanese' the timeline translation was already taxing enough (I'm sure anyone who was around at the time could see how much I had to come here and beg for help), and that was just a timeline with really simple and straigthforward sentences.

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO galbaldy_thumbs.jpg, 1 MB, 1900x2307
Suku Suku Scratch
Anonymous Fri Nov 23 2012 15:57:12 No.8471709 ViewReport	
Time for your weekend homework assignment /m/. You are to scratch build your favorite design.

For reference you are given Mitsuaki Misaki's Suku-Suku Scratch articles series published monthly in Dengeki Hobby from July 2010 to September 2012 detailing his build of the 1/100 Galbaldy Beta. His name should be familiar to at least some because he's the author of the world famous Gundam Scratch Build Manual which itself is a compilation of Suku-Suku Scratch articles from 1999-2003.

The article series goes through the many, many ways and techniques you can use to build what you desire. This is raw Japanese and unlikely to ever be translated but still incredibly useful. If you don't know japanese or anything about plastic models this might be overwhealming and confusing. If you do have at least some basis in model building this should be very insightful.

http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?t8492p0mvhbpvl5

Good luck with your build.

Evangelion: 3.0 You Can (Not) Redo. (????????????:Q) translation project

The translation is based on the following audio-rip:
http://www.mediafire.com/?dr14o0df22v7lx2

Format your scenes according to the model: "MM:SS — text" (Not every single sentence, just where a scene starts and ends, so we can put the dialogues in the correct order. Check the translation section for examples)

https://github.com/eva3/Evangelion--3.0-Translation

I have no Japanese knowledge, but am willing to give control of the repository to translators who can fix and more dynamically add translations.

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO [GUIS] Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger (...).jpg, 56 kB, 640x480
Zyuranger 44
MegaWikiAnon !!SR4r2NLZDot Wed Oct 24 2012 18:53:47 No.8369297 ViewReport	
How do you start a Goushi centric episode? By playing Mei’s character song of course! No, I don’t why they picked that song but at least it’s catchy. This episode made me shed manly tears, girly tears, and had me going “FUCK YEAH!” all at the same time. It’s pretty amazing and manages to be happier than the last two episodes but still pretty sad. This episode is a bit like that Mei episode we had a while back, in the sense that Goushi is the only ranger in this episode, until the very end of course. The character of the day, Sayaka, is really cool and I almost wish she was a recurring guest. Fun note about her actress: She’s sppeared in Turboranger episode 31 and Fiveman episode 34. Also according to this short entry she did a lot of action scenes in these episodes and because she was wearing a skirt there was, obviously, a lot of panty shots. Now apparently she’s rather proud of these shots. Don’t believe me? Here’s Magenta’s summary of the article: “Basically “she had a lot of action scenes and she was in a skirt with bloomers that ended up causing a lot of panty shots because creepy fucking filming techniques, but for some reason this crazy bitch found it kinda amusing and is proud of it”". So yeah… I’ll just leave you with that, and this link to Mei’s character song: Yumemiru Otome no Chikara Kobu

http://www.mediafire.com/?qakahi0hjttjfld

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO ChristmasPerseus.jpg, 66 kB, 480x272
Anonymous Sat Oct 20 2012 19:15:35 No.8356212 ViewReport	
Anyone playing it, patch the game with the 1.01 patch. It fixes framerate issues and freeze glitches.

>Download http://www.mediafire.com/?26qxcveunj98b0f
>Put iso_tool into the PSP/GAME/ folder
>Run ISO Tool
>Pick your Danball Senki W ISO
>Hit X, pick Create Updater
>When it's done go back to the XMB
>Highlight the Game file it made, hit Triangle and hit Update, download the 1.01 patch
>When it's done, open ISO Tool back up
>Select Danball Senki W's ISO again
>Pick "Update" to re-compile the ISO to 1.01
>Delete the game file you used to do the update
>Run the ISO as usual

Framerate gets much smoother and stable, and the freeze issues are solved.

>>8316120
Unsourced hokum the best kind of hokum.

>>8315485
A lots of things in our universe is straight out, pure unadulterated nonsense.

Like, isn't it weird, that our moon covers the sun exactly when it passes in front of it? This would mean, that from earths perspective, the moon is just as small as the distance to the sun is long - it's given it's size and orbit, in the perfect place. That's one hell of a coincidence, isn't it? It really really is, we're the only known configuration that has anything remotely close to that.

If we ever meet some genuine aliens, we could open up a tourist attraction! "See the exotic moon of Earth as it covers the sun EXACTLY!"
I'm sure it would warrant an entry in the Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy.

What's also cool about the moon, is that it rotates at the exact right speed so that the same side always faces earth. "The dark side of the moon" is a genuine thing. Not saying this is in any way proof or that I believe it myself, just saying.

Anonymous Mon Oct 01 2012 22:37:52 No.8293393 ViewReport	
Well I just beat the game. All of it. Including the extra hell missions. Here's some tips.
-For the EX missions you only have to kill the giant white cannon thing that has 30k health to win.
-The Last Hell stage will break your balls into two. You will HAVE to have units dishing out 20k+ damage to every unit to even have a chance at winning.
-Beating all the stages buys every pilot that you have unlocked for you/
-The final boss is a red looking Halphas Gundam with a coat, I'll take a picture of it. Beating the final boss unlocks the original suits like Master Phoeinx and Shin Knight Gundam for development.
-Turn A Black History is not the final boss, there's no 'true' Qanta and there's no ELS Setsuna.
That's all there is. I'll try to upload a save file to mediafire since I've got all the units unlocked.

VF-kun !!hMpyEgtTibK Mon Oct 01 2012 12:43:50 No.8290973 ViewReport	
So, as a bit of a cultural exchange, I decided to go ahead and sub an episode of KOUSOKU DENJIN ALBEGAS.

I gave the sub files the appropriate name, so just put them in the same folder as the video and it should be play.

Intro: http://www.mediafire.com/?q1emy1spfq211ln
Intro Subs: http://www.mediafire.com/?1jkul4dknjdyfq4

Episode 1: http://www.mediafire.com/?1cxcknn8p8l4nxz
Episode 1 subs: http://www.mediafire.com/?a77xtftvi80ijpk

A warning for anyone who is going to watch this.

1. This IS the Arabic release, I wasn't able to get the Japanese audio for this and I wouldn't have been able to translate that, the script is different.
2. This isn't my encode, whoever did this ripped the Japanese DVDs, slapped on the Arabic dub, and cut out parts that the Arabic edition of the show didn't have, but they also hardsubbed some "RIPPED BY" credits at the beginning that I couldn't remove. Sorry.
3. The dialogue and the dubbing is pretty inconsistent and is kinda funny to hear. I'm sure most of you will get a few laughs out of how bad it can get.
4. I probably won't do much beyond the OP and the first episode, unless people are interested in it. This really isn't the best way to watch the show, but I don't see any alternatives so I'll do it if people want to.

I'm sure most of you won't like it, so I decided to include something extra perspective in my next post to make this thread worth your time.

EPISODE.24: HUMILIATION AT BAIKAL (5)

The Gundam pilots, now isolated on Earth, get word of a transport involving Taurus space-use mobile suits to the Baikal base. However, would the route be via land or air? While Quatre and the Maguanac team quickly attacked a transport train, it turned out to be a decoy. the Gundam Heavyarms launches an attack on a transport plane carrying Taurus suits as Heero in the Wing Gundam appears and continues on ahead. There, he comes under attack by Zechs in the Tallgeese. Just then, as the two engage in a deadly battle, Lady Une makes a daring move. With the colonies taken as hostages, what will Heero’s next move be?!

http://www.mediafire.com/?rkjl8f1v5rar95d

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO [RHS] Platinumhugen Ordian - 01 (...).jpg, 55 kB, 640x480
Anonymous Tue Sep 25 2012 19:40:56 No.8267961 ViewReport	
So as I understand it /m/ - There are subs for a show called Platinumhugen Ordian, but the quality of [A-Keep]'s subs are not very good. One of the biggest complaints I hear about this show is that: it doesn't make a lick of sense. Having seen the level of translation quality of the first few episodes I can understand why. Now I'm not going to say this is an amazing show, but I get the feeling that, what is otherwise labelled as a really bad show by most people, it is probably an average show with some good points and some bad points.

In an effort to try and understand what's going on I decided to translate episode one myself. I've also gone and used a better quality DVDrip raw and made it a softsubbed mkv.

The only other thing to note is I'm not all that confident of my own Japanese in a scene or two and I'd love it if someone with better Japanese took over and carried on in my place. Any one willing to give it a shot?

I'm putting this out there to raise some awareness nonetheless.

[RHS] Platinumhugen Ordian - 01 [C1AB8CAD].mkv - http://www.mediafire.com/?rqx1a99a12f7788

I'll probably do episode 2 as well. Any way to give an idea of how bad the original subs were, I'll post some comparison images in the following posts.

View SameGoogleiqdbSauceNAO MSG.jpg, 277 kB, 1800x2700
Anonymous Fri Sep 21 2012 02:26:15 No.8247750 ViewReport	
There have been a lot of mentions recently, both here and other places, of the original MSG novels. I found a version floating around and started reading. Let me just say: Holy Shit, these are good.

The downside, however, was that this ebook version I found was riddled with errors. Being the OCD man-child that I am, I have corrected the worst of these, as documented here.

1) Replaced all instaces of "Gun-dam" with "Gundam"
2) Replaced all instaces of "psychom" with "psycommu"
3) Replaced the word "son" with "daughter" when referring to Mineva Zabi
4) Removed random numbers from the middle of words.
5) Replaced the God-awful collage cover of the original epub with the God-awful cover from the 2004 dead-tree omnibus edition (seen at left)

Other than the above, I left the text as I found it. I'm fairly certian, however, that there are still OCR-derived errors such as numbers or other symbols in place of letters. If this bothers you, learn how to edit epub files and fix it yourself.

So far as I can tell, there is no official ebook version of these books, but in the event that one becomes availible, I will immediately take this file down, and replace it with that one.

Share and Enjoy.

http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?k844hk4p7iqhz9y

Paul 'OtaKing' Johnson !!UtFBAkwWhRI Mon Sep 17 2012 21:35:39 No.8236439 ViewReport	
And what are you youngsters talking about in this thread??
OH HO!

Ahh, yeah.. it was a bit surprising to wake up to a billion mails and whatnot (I'll have to go through those all later). These things happen though, and I really should have thought in advance and put a timecode or watermark stating that it's unfinished or something on it. Obviously, I don't mind people seeing it (that's kind of the point)... but when it's done and actually has some continuity. Still, uber foolishness on my part, I think!

The guy wasn't being an asshole though. I don't think he meant any harm, and there are a few other ones up as well now so I think it's too late to try and get them taken down, as more will just spring up. Maybe the heat will die down though.

I reckon the best thing for future updates is to mediafire link them here (with a big THIS SHIT IS UNFINISHED plastered on the video just in case, as >>8234956 said).

It's a tricky one, as although I could just go off and do the rest on my own and then post it when it's finished, the animation is legitimately much better with input (it looks much better now that the first version). So I'll just keep showing the updates here I reckon, as long as people don't get sick and tired of it!

I tell you what though, there are literally face-smashing waves of goodwill flying at me from pretty much everyone, lots of emails wishing me all the best etc. People really can be exceptionally cool sometimes, and it is much appreciated.
Thanks very much, /m/en. I'll buy you all Char helmets when I'm rich.

Gundam AGE Translations general
CrashmanX !!GAKnwBRBYtV Fri Sep 14 2012 01:56:33 No.8220406 ViewReport	
Where'd that last thread go? Anyways V0.7 is here! Includes a fix for the custom character menu!

http://www.sendspace.com/file/hvqejt
http://www.mediafire...1ro765lt589cl11
http://www.4shared.c...n_Patch_9.html?

>How do I install this shit?
Use UMDGen to open your ISO. Extract the C01.CPK to the Patch folder (With xDelta.exe in it)
Run the UsePatch.bat
Rename the C01 Translated.cpk to C01.CPK
Drag and drop the C01.CPK (Your translated one) into the same folder as the original on UMDGen.
It'll ask if you want to replace it with your new one, hit yes.
Save as a new ISO.
Put the ISO on your PSP and enjoy.

>What's Translated?
Item names, Parts names, Materials, Dropped Tech, Weapon Skills, Unit names, All pilot names, 90% of the menus, All weapons, all Pilot Skills, and more.

>Which version is this for?
Universe Accel. HOWEVER, in theory it should work on Cosmic Drive as well, I have not tested it yet though.

>Can I use this with a save from my untranslated version?
YES! You in fact can.

>What doesn't work?
Nothing. Everything works in this version.

>When will a new version be out?
I'm hoping to pop out weekly builds if not sooner. We'll see though it depends on how things progress.

>I found a problem!
Great! Post it here. Screenshot if you can and how you came across it. If it's not translated let me know and I'll look for it.

The Actor who plays the commander role in a Sentai Hero series stops a man from taking a voyeur video of a high school girl (08/26 17:20)
The Sentai Hero's Commander has a very active life outside of television. He was able to seize a voyeur trying to take a video secretly.

According to the police, the actor and director Hideo Sakaki (42 years old) saw a suspicious man standing behind a school girl at a book store in the Setagaya district of Tokyo.
Mr. Hideo who caught the suspect: "He was taking a video from underneath her skirt. I didn't think he would try to run away, but I instinctively started to chase him."
The suspect caught red-handed is a taxi driver named Tetsuya Kawakami (60 years old). He has been arrested for investigation. Mr. Sakaki plays the role of Commander Takeshi Kuroki in the TV Asahi series "Tokumei Sentai Gobusters".
Mr. Hideo Sakaki who caught the suspect: "I would have done the same thing in any situation. I would like to ask the suspect not to try this again. I would like to say: Shut-down Complete"

Anonymous Mon Aug 20 2012 04:26:06 No.8126207 ViewReport	
>>8125935 Why dont you mediafire or KRDL
>>because we dont want anything to do with them nor do we wish to be associated with them

>>Sendspace delete after 30 days of inactivity, so not ideal, but we do post some links when the files are under 300meg
>>Mediafire has been deleting accounts recently involved with mass sharing of videos, also they are a target of the MPAA/FBI witch hunt, so its not advisable to use them

>>We are only a small group so making a mass of new links is very hard given we all work for a living and have limited bandwidth at times to do uploading, its more a case of only reuploading when all links are dead and gone, other than that we just let them tick along, not much we can do about the slow download speeds from sites, but with less and less bandwidth available since everybody is trying to use the sites, it makes it hard to get a good decent stable server that is out in the public domain.

KimiNozo Guy !xzOQ9IEqYQ Sun Aug 19 2012 15:29:47 No.8123999 ViewReport	
>>8123967
I'd almost go far enough to say that CG can be seen as a form of modern claymation , as they share the same basic idea of "build the model, then animate it."

Whether or not they can actually make them mesh CG into animation or live footage is really dependant on the studios' intents. They managed to mesh live footage, matte paintings and models in Blade Runner's opening, and I have a careful belief towards the studios and their staff that they will strife to make CG work as intended.

And the embarrassing attempts will most likely stay as long as the directors etc think themselves as artists rather than craftsmen, but that's another thing altogether.
However, if the industries keep learning and understanding the CG at the same speeding pace they have, attempts will become nearly extinct outside when trying something new.

Uploaded some TE Pixiv packs to MF if somebody wants them http://www.mediafire.com/?8p6pjmsziajn5

Anonymous Sat Aug 04 2012 18:09:20 No.8071265 ViewReport	
>>8071230
Everything that you need to start can be found here:
http://www.mediafire.com/?uj4dnnin9835p

Read Extra (only Meiya and Sumika routes are compulsory for unlocking Unlimited but I recommend reading every routes), then read Unlimited (your favorite character's route first, then the others in the order you see fit) and finish with Alternative (no routes here).

You might also want to watch (as the VN is not fully translated) the Kimi ga Nozomu Eien anime, followed by the Akane Maniax OVA (which leads directly into Muv-Luv Extra) before starting Extra.
Keep Ayumayu Theater for after you finish Alternative.

http://www.mediafire.com/?svxwm1vn36dmb

Game actually has a surprising amount of mecha in it. Aside from the titular not!Nadesico, there's also Labor/Arm Slave hybrids abound that see a good bit of action.
Game was also pretty funny from what little I've read so far.

Anonymous Fri Jul 27 2012 02:05:20 No.8038804 ViewReport	
>>8038694

I think you meant Kamen Rider J, as well. Which IS a good suggestion, together with Kamen Rider ZO. Both of them are fairly short (40 minutes or so) self contained movies and are both really good. They're available here: http://megaanon.wordpress.com/

Grown Ups In Spandex, aka GUIS, just finished their Jetman sub. Jetman is generally regarded as one of the best Sentai EVER so you might want to check that out.

For full Kamen Rider shows I'd suggest Black, fully subbed by Century Kings, for Showa. Thing is, the guy got banned from mediafire so I dunno where/if you can get the whole series. For Heisei, Kuuga is the way to go, available here: http://midnightcrewsubs.blogspot.com.ar/search/label/Kuuga

Kuuga is another really well regarded series and probably the most fun I ever had with a toku show. It is straight up amazing and it'll make you hate Decade for what it did to Kuuga.

- All cards from the AkibaRanger Set(s) are Unofficial Cards.
- All other cards are Official Cards.
- Characters with the x[Y] trait may not be set on Units whose name includes Y.

SDGO General
Old one here: >>8026579

Wiki: http://www.sdgowiki.com
Comprehensive MS Information: http://www.olgame.tw/sds/robot_inq.php
VM trick for free Astros (Simple): http://pastebin.com/vm1QamEU
VM trick for free Astros (Detailed): http://pastebin.com/ikqXsYVz
Astro Offers: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fyJ2ttwZHvhbOf8W6BE_n8cHUN-AkHN7yZXJ-oFKHGU/edit

NA Website: sdgo.ogplanet.com/en/main.og
NA /m/ Clans: Men of Destiny, SDGO Trolls, OZ Military
NA not /m/ Clans: Virtue

/m/ Music Pack: http://www.mediafire.com/?t6xx2cnd534a822 / http://www.mediafire.com/?w8gds7781hb3rkb
AGI Benchmarks: 4.5 \ 9 \ 13.5 \ 18 \ 22.5 \ 27 \ 31.5 \36 \ 40.5 \ 45 \ 49.5
Speed Soft Cap: 24.9
Note: You get more out of your custom points for AGI, HP, SPD but less for OC.

Q. What does Agility affect?
A. Higher Agility shortens animations like stopping a boost, changing direction, starting a boost, but not melee or projectiles.

Note, if you're a new player don't be concerned about learning how to do advanced techniques. Focus on learning tactics, taking cover, maneuvering, and teamwork. B ranks are good to start off with because your mistakes are cushioned a bit. C ranks are also worth trying if you want to train spartan style.

Anonymous Sat Jul 21 2012 15:47:34 No.8016504 ViewReport	
>>8016030
Deep in the bowels of the Original Hive (aka age main office or Kouki's house, pick one), there exists a magical tool. Miyata, fool as he was, knew not to cross it, and his impeccable penning skills were gifted him by that tool when he sacrificed his own stock in imitation of Kouki's monthly rituals.

But that's not our business. In the meantime, have the wonderchest that is Kiminozo Guy's ML CG collection.

http://www.mediafire.com/?kkc1fh9l077sn#9j7a9g37601n5

Uncanny valley feelings while browsing the folder aside, I think the sprites have great potential.

>>8016341

AMERICA would turn to worshipping one-dimensional cannot-fail-cannot-die super-powered heroes if they were the ones buttfucked by people dressed in faux banana skins screaming incoherent bloody murder.

But actually, you kinda forgot that close-combat training is part and parcel of all armed forces, especially those with commandos as part of them. It's just that in ML, it's more economical to hit with a sword rather than the butt of a rifle that could be used to output x2 the amount of bullets.

That, and we're kinda not talking about "our-world" Japan, who largely abandoned imperialism, it's "their-world" Japan, who swallowed shame and was allowed, apart from keeping their sword collector's obsession, a great deal of other things, including a larger military force, navy, and generally more autonomy rather than lobotomy.

NA /m/ Clans: Men of Destiny, SDGO Trolls, OZ Military

/m/ Music Pack: http://www.mediafire.com/?t6xx2cnd534a822 / http://www.mediafire.com/?w8gds7781hb3rkb
AGI Benchmarks: 4.5 \ 9 \ 13.5 \ 18 \ 22.5 \ 27 \ 31.5 \36 \ 40.5 \ 45 \ 49.5
Speed Soft Cap: 24.9
Note: You get more out of your custom points for AGI, HP, SPD but less for OC.

Q. What does Agility affect?
A. Higher Agility shortens animations like stopping a boost, changing direction, starting a boost, but not melee or projectiles.

Note, if you're a new player don't be concerned about learning how to do advanced techniques. Focus on learning tactics, taking cover, maneuvering, and teamwork. B ranks are good to start off with because your mistakes are cushioned a bit. C ranks are also worth trying if you want to train spartan style.

Anonymous Thu Jul 19 2012 23:41:15 No.8010770 ViewReport	
>>8009864
>First you need a Memory Stick with, say, at least two gigabytes of free space. 
>Make sure you're on official firmware 6.60, if not do an official update
>Next use this link:
http://code.google.com/p/procfw/downloads/list
>And download 6.60PRO-C fix 3.
>Unzip it
>Next download the rars for the iso in the mediafire link
>Unzip the first rar to get the ISO.
>Plug your PSP into your computer, 1/2/3000 mini-usb to usb, for GO the USB cord of your charger; either way it should put you on USB Mode if not go there under settings
>Put UPDATE and FastRecovery into "PSP/GAME/", make a GAME folder if needed
>Disconnect PSP, run PRO Update, do as instructed
>Re-connect to PC after it reboots
>Make an "ISO" folder at the root and put the unzipped ISO in
>Disconnect
>Go to games on the XMB, should pop up under 
>If PSP crashes, runs out of power, or you hard power down, run Fast Recovery to reboot the firmware and be able to play the ISO again

View SameGoogleiqdbSauceNAO tripods.jpg, 395 kB, 1925x1044
The Tripods (unabridged audiobooks)
Raul "Otter Marquis" Johansen Thu Jul 19 2012 16:50:58 No.8009475 ViewReport	
Hello, /m/. Definitely not Paul "OtaKing" Johnson here.

All four of The Tripods books are up in audiobook form on Demonoid at:
http://www.demonoid.me/files/?category=17&subcategory=All&quality=All&seeded=0&exter
nal=2&query=the+tripods&uid=0&sort=

I just thought some of you might like to listen to them, as they're classics of /m/ literature. I'm seeding as well so they should come down quickly. I was hoping to upload them to Mediafire or somewhere but they're about 260mb per book and too big...

If you don't know about the Tripods, it's a trilogy (and a prequel book that was written after) written in 1967 about the future Earth ruled by giant alien Tripod machines (they could be sentient machines, or there could be things inside pilotting them. It's one of the mysteries that is uncovered along the way). They have subjugated mankind and regressed technology back to feudal times, and everyone has to have a mind-control device implanted onto their skull at age 14, which makes the population placid and accepting of being ruled by giant mechs.

It's supposedly a series for children, but being written in the late 60s is about as different from Harry Potter and The Hunger Games as you can imagine really, with actual good writing, plenty of violence and lines like "Horror, above all, at how closely I had come to falling - no - to throwing myself into something beside which suicide was clean and good."
So higher level literature than "Harry Potter felt sad."

Give them a listen. The narrator is very good (I'm 3/4s through the first book and loving it).

Anonymous Mon Jul 09 2012 01:24:52 No.7969379 ViewReport	
Yo, buddy, still alive?

Got some Steel Messiah here. What's Steel Messiah? Well some of you might remember seeing a comic where Sanger was going full I AM THE SWORD OF MAGUS and a load of characters were going full tilt just trying to slow him down. That's from Steel Messiah. That translated bit wasn't even the full chapter that. And it's actually part of an overarching story involving all your favourite shows, or at least the ones that got into Alpha Gaiden. Plus a good handful of originals. Expect to see lots of Sanger, then Irui and BIG FIRE. But there's plenty of great crossovers here.

http://www.mediafire.com/?9sgupr8zt98okw6

At least I think I've got all of Steel Messiah there.

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO youmighthaveheartproblems.jpg, 37 kB, 633x471
Sailor Moon OP 1&2
MegaWikiAnon !!SR4r2NLZDot Fri Jul 06 2012 20:40:42 No.7960051 ViewReport	
Sometimes when you get bored you do weird things. When I get bored I either stare at a wall, or I sub something really random. In this case it was a few months back and I had the Sailor Moon theme stuck in my head. Well after a while I snapped, found a RAW, and subbed it. Now, this was something that was never supposed to be released. Actually, I thought I had deleted it but nope, it was just hidden away on my HDD. I figured with the recent announcement of a reboot Sailor Moon anime coming out in 2013 that “Why not? I put time and effort into this. Maybe someone will appreciate it.” So included in this .zip is the first two openings which both use the same song “Moonlight Densetsu”but they each have different visuals so I couldn’t pick just one. As far as Sailor Moon goes my only exposure to it half of the Toku (it’s on my “to watch” list), the Sailor V manga (I’m a sucker for Sailor Venus), and this song. I’ve never actually seen the anime. I think that makes me a terrible person. But oh well. Enjoy!

A word of caution: These videos are the first time I messed around with stuff like “fading” and “font color”. So if something fucked up, let me know!

http://www.mediafire.com/?zfkfnj8rhd8ak3p	
View SameGoogleiqdbSauceNAO Kamen_Rider_V3.jpg, 144 kB, 400x383

NA Website: sdgo.ogplanet.com/en/main.og
NA /m/ Clans: Men of Eternity, Men of Destiny, SDGO Trolls, OZ Military, Virtue

/m/ Music Pack: http://www.mediafire.com/?t6xx2cnd534a822 / http://www.mediafire.com/?w8gds7781hb3rkb
AGI Benchmarks: 4.5 \ 9 \ 13.5 \ 18 \ 22.5 \ 27 \ 31.5 \36 \ 40.5 \ 45 \ 49.5
Speed Soft Cap: 24.9
Note: You get more out of your custom points for AGI, HP, SPD but less for OC.

Q. What does Agility affect?
A. Higher Agility shortens animations like stopping a boost, changing direction, starting a boost, but not melee or projectiles.

Note, if you're a new player don't be concerned about learning how to do advanced techniques. Focus on learning tactics, taking cover, maneuvering, and teamwork. B ranks are good to start off with because your mistakes are cushioned a bit. C ranks are also worth trying if you want to train spartan style.

NA Website: sdgo.ogplanet.com/en/main.og
NA /m/ Clans: Men of Eternity, Men of Destiny, SDGO Trolls, OZ Military, Virtue (Only if you're a scrub)
Please check in with your respective clan for attendance.

/m/ Music Pack: http://www.mediafire.com/?t6xx2cnd534a822 / http://www.mediafire.com/?w8gds7781hb3rkb
AGI Benchmarks: 4.5 \ 9 \ 13.5 \ 18 \ 22.5 \ 27 \ 31.5 \36 \ 40.5 \ 45 \ 49.5
Speed Soft Cap: 24.9
Note: You get more out of your custom points for AGI, HP, SPD but less for OC.

Q. What does Agility affect?
A. Higher Agility shortens animations like stopping a boost, changing direction, starting a boost, but not melee or projectiles.

Note, if you're a new player don't be concerned about learning how to do advanced techniques. Focus on learning tactics, taking cover, maneuvering, and teamwork. B ranks are good to start off with because your mistakes are cushioned a bit. C ranks are also worth trying if you want to train spartan style.

In case anyone's interested;
here's the PS2 game.

http://www.mediafire.com/?g8u2atrb0rrcj

Pretty fun. Plays like an RPG for the most part. You can level up relationships with other characters which in turn can change who Noriko's copilot is. That in turn affects what attacks you can unlock. There's an action portion too.

Kamen Rider Black Volume 1 released by Happy Scans and Midnight Crew!

"Thanks to their translator, to Mein Square and to Kazuhiko's great typesetting, we're pleased to present another amazing Shotaro Ishinomori work...has it really been that long since we finished the original? Thanks to The Midnight Crew we can bring this one out. Hopefully this one will go more smoothly than Kikaider has. MC will have their TL in charge of the project there, and we all had a great time working on it. Enjoy, and please consider dropping a line for translators, cleaners or typesetters!"

GoogleiqdbSauceNAO $(KGrHqQOKm8E5JBicGfiBOcWNNHF4w~ (...).jpg, 137 kB, 800x600
Anonymous Sat Jun 23 2012 07:48:57 No.7908565 ViewReport	
Hello.
I'm just reading this short novel that came with the Tie Fighter 1994 game. It's here if you want it

http://www.mediafire.com/?pcpx455tnwja8bn

Though certainly not high tier literature, it's pretty cool stuff if you want to actually read about what it's like inside a Star Destroyer (there are stores and leisure centers apparenly, a bit like the SDF-1), and spotting enemies in space from the ambient light of suns glinting off the metal when your sensors don't work.

I'm only partway in but it seems like a decent enough light read, and the only thing that deals with life on a Star Destroyer. The guy has just started his Tie Fighter training so I expect paragraphs on dual-linking laser fire and boosting engine power. It's kind of Bodacious Space Pirates with its talk of technical shit so far.

SDGO Mods Starter Pack*: http://www.mediafire.com/?1y7xb3ap8yn6yyk

AGI Benchmarks: 4.5 \ 9 \ 13.5 \ 18 \ 22.5 \ 27 \ 31.5 \36 \ 40.5 \ 45 \ 49.5
Speed Soft Cap: 24.9
Note: You get more out of your custom points for AGI, HP, SPD but less for OC.

Q. What does Agility affect?
A. Higher Agility shortens animations like stopping a boost, changing direction, starting a boost, but not melee or projectiles.

Note, if you're a new player don't be concerned about learning how to do advanced techniques. Focus on learning tactics, taking cover, maneuvering, and teamwork. B ranks are good to start off with because your mistakes are cushioned a bit. C ranks are also worth trying if you want to train spartan style.

Q. What does Agility affect?
A. Higher Agility shortens animations like stopping a boost, changing direction, starting a boost, but not melee or projectiles.

Q. What servers are /m/ on?
A. NA mainly. Some of us are on KR and SEA though.

Note, if you're a new player don't be concerned about learning how to do advanced techniques. Focus on learning tactics, taking cover, maneuvering, and teamwork. B ranks are good to start off with because your mistakes are cushioned a bit. C ranks are also worth trying if you want to train spartan style.
